docs.title: ITS Vocabulary
docs.text:
A vocabulary defined for Intelligent Transport Systems and documented as a formal ontology. The contents of this vocabulary are periodically standardized in ISO 14812, whereas this file is maintained through a GitHub project.

The original version of the vocabulary was published as ISO/TS 14812:2022. Edition 2 was released in 2025.

With edition 3, the draft standard is now generated from this ontology file, originally developed in 2026.

The formal definition of the terms is available in OWL Syntax.

docs.title: ADS-dedicated vehicle
docs.text: ADS-equipped vehicle (3.7.3.15) designed for only driverless operation for complete trips

docs.title: Formalization for ADS-dedicated vehicle
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf ads-equippedVehicle

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.3.17 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ADS-dedicated vehicle

docs.title: ADS-equipped vehicle
docs.text:
vehicle (3.7.1.1) integrated with an ADS (3.7.3.10)

NOTE: The terms "automated vehicle" and "AV" are often used in a colloquial form. However, these terms can be used to mean either an "ADS-equipped vehicle" or a "vehicle with an engaged ADS". The term "ADS-equipped vehicle" is preferred since it is more precise and descriptive in its meaning.

docs.title: Formalization for ADS-equipped vehicle
docs.text: Property Constraint comprises some ads subClassOf vehicle

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.3.15 skos::altLabel AV skos::altLabel automated vehicle skos::hiddenLabel autonomous vehicle skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ADS-equipped vehicle

docs.title: ADS
docs.text:
driving automation system (3.7.3.6) that is able to perform the entire DDT (3.7.3.1) on a sustained basis

NOTE: The abbreviated form ("ADS") is the most preferred form and the alternative form ("Automated Driving System") uses initial capitals to avoid confusion with the more general "driving automation system".

docs.title: Formalization for ADS
docs.text: Property Constraint canControl some ads-equippedVehicle performsAllOf some dynamicDrivingTask subClassOf drivingAutomationSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel Automated Driving System clause 3.7.3.10 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ADS

docs.title: B2C mobility sharing app
docs.text: mobility app (3.5.13.1) that assists a transport user (3.5.2.3) in acquiring a transport service (3.5.2.1) from a specific business

docs.title: Formalization for B2C mobility sharing app
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf mobilityApp

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.5.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel B2C mobility sharing app

docs.title: DDT performance-relevant system failure
docs.text:
malfunction in a vehicle system (3.2.1.5) that prevents the driving automation system (3.7.3.6) from reliably performing its portion of the DDT (3.7.3.1) on a sustained basis

NOTE: The malfunction can be internal to the driving automation system or part of another vehicle system.

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.3.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel DDT performance-relevant system failure

docs.title: ISO named area
docs.text: Note 1 to entry: ISO 3166-2 includes codes for major subdivisions of countries and states.

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel area identified using ISO 3166-2 identifiers clause 3.4.3.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel ISO named area

docs.title: ITS application role
docs.text: ITS-S user need (3.5.4.4) expressed as a formal set of interoperability requirements that need to be fulfilled to satisfy a portion of functionality of an ITS application (3.2.8.1)

docs.title: Formalization for ITS application role
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf its-sUserNeed

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.9.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS application role

docs.title: ITS application specification
docs.text: one or more documents (3.1.6.3) that detail the interoperability design (3.2.8.2) for an ITS application (3.2.8.1)

docs.title: Formalization for ITS application specification
docs.text: Property Constraint details some interoperabilityDesign for some itsApplication

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.8.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS application specification

docs.title: ITS application
docs.text:
requirements for an ITS service (3.5.3.1) that involves an association of two or more complementary ITS-S application processes (3.2.9.2)

NOTE: An ITS application can also involve associations with nodes that are not ITS stations.

docs.title: Formalization for ITS application
docs.text: Property Constraint involves min 2 owl::Thing realizationOf some itsService

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.8.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS application

docs.title: ITS component
docs.text:
physical object (3.1.8.1) that has been assigned one or more functional objects (3.1.8.6) in the provision of one or more ITS services (3.5.3.1)

NOTE: Physical objects are ITS components if they are an integral part of the system (3.1.2.1); otherwise they are terminators (3.1.8.3).

docs.title: Formalization for ITS component
docs.text: Property Constraint aggregates some functionalObject subClassOf physicalObject

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.8.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS component

docs.title: ITS deployment architecture
docs.text: deployment architecture (3.1.9.3) for one or more ITS services (3.5.3.1)

docs.title: Formalization for ITS deployment architecture
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf deploymentArchitecture

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.9.7 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS deployment architecture

docs.title: ITS deployment
docs.text:
installation capable of performing one or more ITS applications (3.2.8.1)

NOTE: An ITS deployment typically refers to the support, central and roadside ITS stations coupled with a tacit acknowledgement of the mobile ITS stations that will communicate with the support, central or roadside ITS stations.

docs.title: Formalization for ITS deployment
docs.text: Property Constraint installationOf some itsImplementation

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.8.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS deployment

docs.title: ITS implementation
docs.text:
integration of each physical object (3.1.8.1) necessary to implement one or more ITS applications (3.2.8.1)

NOTE: An ITS application typically requires multiple components (e.g. an ITS-S acting as a user and another ITS-S acting as a provider). An ITS implementation includes a sample of each component necessary for the service but often does not represent a complete deployment.

docs.title: Formalization for ITS implementation
docs.text: Property Constraint implements some itsApplication

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.8.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS implementation

docs.title: ITS on-board equipment
docs.text:
vehicle system (3.2.1.5) that provides all ITS functionality on-board the vehicle (3.7.1.1)

NOTE: ITS on-board equipment relates to any functionality. When there is a need to distinguish between core functionality and that by a special vehicle, the term can be further refined by indicating the type of vehicle to which the on-board equipment relates. For example, emergency vehicle on-board equipment can provide specialized functionality.

docs.title: Formalization for ITS on-board equipment
docs.text: Property Constraint comprises some itsOn-boardUnit subClassOf vehicleSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel OBE altPrefLabel on-board equipment clause 3.2.6.1 skos::altLabel onboard equipment skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS on-board equipment

docs.title: ITS on-board unit
docs.text:
part of on-board equipment (3.2.6.1) that provides wireless connectivity to other ITS components (3.1.8.2) external to the vehicle (3.7.1.1)

NOTE: An OBU implementation can also include ITS functionality.

docs.title: Formalization for ITS on-board unit
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf connectedUnit

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel OBU altPrefLabel on-board unit clause 3.2.6.2 skos::altLabel onboard unit skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS on-board unit

docs.title: ITS planning architecture
docs.text: planning architecture (3.1.9.2) for one or more ITS services (3.5.3.1)

docs.title: Formalization for ITS planning architecture
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf planningArchitecture

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.9.6 skos::prefLabel ITS planning architecture

docs.title: ITS reference architecture
docs.text:
reference architecture (3.1.9.1) for one or more ITS services (3.5.3.1)

NOTE: An ITS architecture can be a reference, planning or deployment architecture (3.1.9.3).

docs.title: Formalization for ITS reference architecture
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf referenceArchitecture

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.9.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS reference architecture

docs.title: ITS roadside equipment
docs.text:
field system (3.2.1.2) that performs localized ITS services (3.5.3.1)

NOTE: ITS services that can be performed by ITS roadside equipment include surveillance, traffic control, information provision, payment transaction services, and/or enforcement

EXAMPLE: traffic signal controller, variable message sign, vehicle detection

docs.title: Formalization for ITS roadside equipment
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf fieldSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS roadway equipment clause 3.2.3.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS roadside equipment

docs.title: ITS service provider
docs.text:
entity (3.1.1.1) that delivers one or more ITS services (3.5.3.1)

NOTE: Cooperative ITS (3.1.2.5) services often require multiple entities cooperatively working together to provide a unified service (3.5.1.1) where the individual entities are simultaneously ITS service providers and ITS users.

docs.title: Formalization for ITS service provider
docs.text: Property Constraint delivers some itsService subClassOf serviceProvider

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel service provider clause 3.5.3.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS service provider

docs.title: ITS service
docs.text: provision of functionality that fulfils one or more ITS user needs (3.5.3.4)

docs.title: Formalization for ITS service
docs.text: Property Constraint for some itsUser fulfils some itsUserNeed subClassOf service

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel service clause 3.5.3.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS service

docs.title: ITS station
docs.text:
bounded secured managed domain (3.2.7.1) that is able to meet requirements of the ITS trust domain (3.2.7.2) within which it is designed to participate

NOTE: The ITS station reference architecture is defined in ISO 21217.

docs.title: Formalization for ITS station
docs.text: Property Constraint describedBy some its-sReferenceArchitecture meetsRequirementsOf some itsTrustDomain subClassOf boundedSecuredManagedDomain

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS-S clause 3.2.7.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS station

docs.title: ITS trust domain
docs.text: set of bounded secured managed domains (3.2.7.1) that meet a defined set of ITS industry security requirements

docs.title: Formalization for ITS trust domain
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf boundedSecuredManagedDomain

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.7.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS trust domain

docs.title: ITS user need
docs.text:
user need (3.5.1.4) for a surface transport system (3.1.2.3) benefit that can be met with the use of information, communication, and transducer technologies

EXAMPLE: Increasing safety, sustainability, efficiency and/or comfort.

docs.title: Formalization for ITS user need
docs.text: Property Constraint desiredResultsOf some itsUser subClassOf userNeed

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel user need clause 3.5.3.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS user need

docs.title: ITS user
docs.text: entity (3.1.1.1) that uses information, communication, and transducer technologies to achieve benefits when using a surface transport system (3.1.2.3)

docs.title: Formalization for ITS user
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf user uses some surfaceTransportSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel user clause 3.5.3.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS user

docs.title: ITS-S access layer
docs.text: communications layer in the ITS station reference architecture (3.1.9.4) corresponding to the physical and data link layers of the OSI model for ITS communications

docs.title: Formalization for ITS-S access layer
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf accessLayer

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.5.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS-S access layer

docs.title: ITS-S application implementation
docs.text:
implementation of an ITS-S application process (3.2.9.2) within the application entity (3.1.5.1)

NOTE: An implementation is typically associated with an implementation name, a version and release number.

docs.title: Formalization for ITS-S application implementation
docs.text: Property Constraint implementationOf some its-sApplication

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.9.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS-S application implementation

docs.title: ITS-S application installation
docs.text: ITS-S application process installation (3.2.9.5) within the application entity (3.1.5.1)

docs.title: Formalization for ITS-S application installation
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf its-sApplicationProcessInstallation

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.9.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS-S application installation

docs.title: ITS-S application process installation
docs.text:
installation of an implementation of an ITS-S application process (3.2.9.2) on an ITS station (3.2.7.3)

NOTE: An implementation is typically associated with an implementation name, a version and release number.

docs.title: Formalization for ITS-S application process installation
docs.text: Property Constraint installationOf some its-sApplicationProcess

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.9.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS-S application process installation

docs.title: ITS-S application process
docs.text:
information manipulation within an ITS station (3.2.7.3) for an ITS-SU service (3.5.4.1)

NOTE: ITS-S application processes use ITS-S services to communicate with other nodes.

docs.title: Formalization for ITS-S application process
docs.text: Property Constraint elementIn some itsStation performsInformationProcessingFor some its-sService

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.9.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS-S application process

docs.title: ITS-S application
docs.text: ITS-S application process (3.2.9.2) residing in the application entity (3.1.5.1)

docs.title: Formalization for ITS-S application
docs.text: Property Constraint residesIn some applicationEntity subClassOf its-sApplicationProcess

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.9.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS-S application

docs.title: ITS-S communication unit
docs.text:
physical unit in an ITS-S unit (3.2.7.4) containing part or all of the functionality of the ITS-S (3.2.7.3)

NOTE: In case an ITS-SU consists of a single physical unit, the ITS-SU and the ITS-SCU are identical. In case an ITS-SU consists of more than one ITS-SCU, then these ITS-SCUs are interconnected via the ITS station-internal network of the ITS-SU.

docs.title: Formalization for ITS-S communication unit
docs.text: Property Constraint contains some functionalObject

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS station communication unit altPrefLabel ITS-SCU clause 3.2.7.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS-S communication unit

docs.title: ITS-S host
docs.text:
ITS-S node (3.2.7.8) comprised of ITS-S (3.2.7.3) functionalities other than the functionalities of an ITS-S router (3.2.7.7), ITS-S border router, ITS-S mobile router or an ITS-S gateway

NOTE: ITS-S border router and ITS-S mobile router are ITS-S routers with added functionalities, which is why they are separately excluded in the above definition.

docs.title: Formalization for ITS-S host
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf its-sNode

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel management host clause 3.2.7.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 as functionality. Revised in ISO/TS 14812:2025 to be an ITS-S node. skos::prefLabel ITS-S host

docs.title: ITS-S node
docs.text: node comprised of a set of functionalities in an ITS-S unit (3.2.7.4) that is connected (3.2.3.6) to the ITS station (3.2.7.3)-internal network or comprises an entire ITS-S unit

docs.title: Formalization for ITS-S node
docs.text: Property Constraint comprises some functionality containedIn some its-sUnit

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.7.8 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS-S node

docs.title: ITS-S reference architecture
docs.text:
reference architecture (3.1.9.1) for handling communications within a physical object (3.1.8.1) as defined in ISO 21217

NOTE: The ITS-S reference architecture provides a model for describing communication.

docs.title: Formalization for ITS-S reference architecture
docs.text: Property Constraint aggregates some applicationEntity aggregates some its-sAccessLayer aggregates some transnetLayer aggregates some facilitiesLayer aggregates some managementEntity aggregates some securityEntity subClassOf referenceArchitecture

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.9.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS-S reference architecture

docs.title: ITS-S router
docs.text: ITS-S node (3.2.7.8) comprised of routing functionalities of an ITS station unit (3.2.7.4) used to connect two networks and to forward packets not explicitly addressed to itself

docs.title: Formalization for ITS-S router
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf its-sNode

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.7.7 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 as functionality. Revised in ISO/TS 14812:2025 to be an ITS-S node. skos::prefLabel ITS-S router

docs.title: ITS-S service
docs.text:
communication functionality of an ITS station (3.2.7.3) that provides the capability to connect to other nodes

NOTE: The definition of ITS-S service predates the adoption of the concept model used for the other service terms in this standard. It is an outlier in that it describes a portion of the functionality contained within the ITS station reference architecture (i.e., the communication functionality) rather than the end functionality of the conceptual ITS station.

docs.title: Formalization for ITS-S service
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf service

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.4.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS-S service

docs.title: ITS-S unit
docs.text:
instance (3.1.15.3) of an physical unit produced by an ITS station (3.2.7.3) implementation (3.1.15.2)

NOTE: This is a clarification of the definition provided in ISO 21217:2020. While the definition for ITS station unit in ISO 21217:2020 refers to an implementation, the full text interchangeably describes it as an implementation or a physical instantiation, but does not define those terms explicitly.

docs.title: Formalization for ITS-S unit
docs.text: Property Constraint comprises some its-sCommunicationUnit instantiationOf some itsStation

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS station unit altPrefLabel ITS-SU clause 3.2.7.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS-S unit

docs.title: ITS-SU service provider
docs.text: ITS-SU (3.2.7.4) that delivers one or more ITS-SU services (3.5.4.1)

docs.title: Formalization for ITS-SU service provider
docs.text: Property Constraint delivers some its-suService isA some its-sUnit subClassOf serviceProvider

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.4.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS-SU service provider

docs.title: ITS-SU service
docs.text:
provision of functionality to fulfil an ITS-SU user need (3.5.4.4)

NOTE: An ITS-SU service refers to the services provided by realizations of ITS-S application processes while an ITS-S service refers to the communication services that these processes use to communicate to other nodes.

docs.title: Formalization for ITS-SU service
docs.text: Property Constraint for some its-suUser fulfils some its-suUserNeed subClassOf service

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.4.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS-SU service

docs.title: ITS-SU user need
docs.text: user need (3.5.1.4) for processing within a bounded, secure, managed domain (3.2.7.1)

docs.title: Formalization for ITS-SU user need
docs.text: Property Constraint requiresProcessingWithin some boundedSecureManagedDomain subClassOf userNeed

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.4.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS-SU user need

docs.title: ITS-SU user
docs.text: entity (3.1.1.1) that has a need to perform processing within a bounded, secure, managed domain (3.2.7.1)

docs.title: Formalization for ITS-SU user
docs.text: Property Constraint has some its-suUserNeed subClassOf user

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.4.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ITS-SU user

docs.title: Jersey barrier
docs.text:
physical traffic separator (3.3.2.1) that consists of a wall with a wide, sloped base designed to divert vehicles (3.7.1.1) back into their traffic lane (3.3.1.13)

NOTE: Jersey barriers are typically modular. They are typically made of concrete but can also be made with other materials such as plastic filled with water or sand.

docs.title: Formalization for Jersey barrier
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf physicalTrafficSeparator

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.2.3 skos::altLabel city block skos::altLabel concrete barrier skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel Jersey barrier

docs.title: P2P mobility sharing app
docs.text: mobility app (3.5.13.1) that assists a transport user (3.5.2.3) in acquiring transport service (3.5.2.1) from an individual that participates in the mobility app's network

docs.title: Formalization for P2P mobility sharing app
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf mobilityApp

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.5.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel P2P mobility sharing app

docs.title: access layer
docs.text:
communications layer that corresponds to the physical and data link layers of the OSI model

NOTE: Within the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF), the term "link layer" is used to describe the same functionality as the access layer.

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.5.2 skos::altLabel link layer skos::altLabel subnet layer skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel access layer

docs.title: actuator
docs.text: device (ISO/IEC 24765:2017, 3.1187) with the capability to convert meaningful signals (ISO/IEC 24765:2017, 3.3738) into changes to one or more properties (ISO/IEC 24765:2017, 3.3207) of a material entity (3.1.1.3)

docs.title: Formalization for actuator
docs.text: Property Constraint changesPropertyOf some materialEntity

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.10.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel actuator

docs.title: agent
docs.text: Person (3.1.1.6) or organization (3.1.1.7) that is capable of performing actions

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value order 8

docs.title: alley
docs.text: road (3.3.1.2) that has buildings, walls or fences on each side

docs.title: Formalization for alley
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf road

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.5.11 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel alley

docs.title: anonymized vehicle reference
docs.text: reference for a vehicle derived from vehicle properties such as registration number but encoded so that it does not allow a human to identify the vehicle directly from the encoded value

docs.title: Formalization for anonymized vehicle reference
docs.text: Property Constraint encodedReferenceFor exactly 1 owl::Thing

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.2.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel anonymized vehicle reference

docs.title: application entity
docs.text:
part of the ITS station reference architecture (3.1.9.4) that is responsible for providing ITS-related functionality

NOTE: Within the US, the National Transportation Communications for ITS Protocol (NTCIP) standards identify an "information layer" on top of the traditional OSI stack. However, the purpose of this layer includes both information configuration and functionality. The ITS-S reference architecture separates these two roles between the management entity (3.1.5.6) and the application entity.

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS-S application entity clause 3.1.5.1 skos::hiddenLabel information layer skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel application entity

docs.title: application template
docs.text: defined annotated outline for an ITS application specification (3.2.8.3)

docs.title: Formalization for application template
docs.text: Property Constraint annotatedOutlineFor some itsApplicationSpecification

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS application template clause 3.2.8.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel application template

docs.title: architecture description
docs.text: work product used to express an architecture (3.1.3.1)

docs.title: Formalization for architecture description
docs.text: Property Constraint aggregates some architectureView aggregates some architectureViewpoint expresses some architecture identifies some system identifies some stakeholder identifies some concern

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.3.2 dcterms::source ISO/IEC/IEEE 42010:2011, 3.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel architecture description

docs.title: architecture framework
docs.text:
conventions, principles and practices for the description of architectures (3.1.3.1) established within a specific domain of application and/or community of stakeholders (3.1.3.4)

EXAMPLE: Generalised Enterprise Reference Architecture and Methodologies (GERAM) [ISO 15704] is an architecture framework.

docs.title: Formalization for architecture framework
docs.text: Property Constraint conventionsPrinciplesAndPracticesFor some architectureDescription

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.3.3 dcterms::source ISO/IEC/IEEE 42010:2011, 3.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel architecture framework

docs.title: architecture model
docs.text: work product representing one or more architecture views (3.1.3.7) and expressed in a format governed by a model kind (3.1.3.8)

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.3.9 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel architecture model

docs.title: architecture view
docs.text: work product expressing the architecture (3.1.3.1) of a system (3.1.2.1) from the perspective of specific system concerns (3.1.3.5)

docs.title: Formalization for architecture view
docs.text: Property Constraint aggregates some architectureModel

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.3.7 dcterms::source ISO/IEC/IEEE 42010:2011, 3.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel architecture view

docs.title: architecture viewpoint
docs.text: work product establishing the conventions for the construction, interpretation and use of architecture views (3.1.3.7) to frame specific system concerns (3.1.3.5)

docs.title: Formalization for architecture viewpoint
docs.text: Property Constraint aggregates some modelKind frames some concern governs some architectureView

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.3.6 dcterms::source ISO/IEC/IEEE 42010:2011, 3.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel architecture viewpoint

docs.title: architecture
docs.text: fundamental concepts or properties of a system (3.1.2.1) in its environment (3.1.3.11) embodied in its elements (3.1.3.10), relationships (3.1.6.8) and in the principles of its design and evolution

docs.title: Formalization for architecture
docs.text: Property Constraint aggregates some element

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel system architecture clause 3.1.3.1 dcterms::source ISO/IEC/IEEE 42010:2011, 3.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel architecture

docs.title: area destination
docs.text: area location, which is the destination of a defined route or itinerary

docs.title: Formalization for area destination
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf areaLocation

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.4.1.9 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel area destination

docs.title: area location
docs.text:
spatial location (3.4.1.2) enclosed within a two-dimensional boundary or boundaries across a defined surface

NOTE: The boundary can consist of a single curvilinear line (e.g. a circle) or multiple curvilinear lines (e.g. the boundaries of city limits) and can consist of multiple enclosed areas.

EXAMPLE: The British Isles.

docs.title: Formalization for area location
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf spatialLocation

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS area location clause 3.4.1.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel area location

docs.title: authentication
docs.text: verification that a message (3.1.11.5) was sent by the purported originator to the intended recipient and that the message was not changed in transit

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.14.1 dcterms::source ISO/IEC 2382:2015 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel authentication

docs.title: authenticator
docs.text: a network entity that executes an authentication (3.1.14.1) process on a message (3.1.11.5)

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.14.2 dcterms::source ISO/IEC/IEEE 8802-21, adapted from skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel authenticator

docs.title: bikesharing service
docs.text:
shared vehicle service (3.5.6.3) that shares bicycles

NOTE: The term "bicycle sharing service" is admitted, but "bikesharing service" is preferred as it has fewer syllables.

docs.title: Formalization for bikesharing service
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf sharedVehicleService

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.12.1 skos::altLabel bicycle sharing service skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel bikesharing service

docs.title: biological entity
docs.text: material entity (3.1.1.3) that was or is a living organism

docs.title: Formalization for biological entity
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf materialEntity

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.1.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel biological entity

docs.title: block-face
docs.text: extent of sidewalk on one side of a street between two consecutive intersections crossing that street

docs.title: Formalization for block-face
docs.text: Property Constraint endsAt some intersection extentOf some sidewalk startsAt some intersection

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.3.9 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel block-face

docs.title: bounded secured managed domain
docs.text: abstract entity (3.1.1.1) representing a managed processing and memory environment (3.1.3.11) that provides protection from code and data that has not been determined to meet established security requirements

docs.title: Formalization for bounded secured managed domain
docs.text: Property Constraint represents some environment subClassOf entity

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel BSMD clause 3.2.7.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel bounded secured managed domain

docs.title: bridge
docs.text: transport facility (3.3.7.1) built over a gap to provide a continuous travel path

docs.title: Formalization for bridge
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf transportFacility

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.7.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel bridge

docs.title: built-in vehicle input device
docs.text:
input device (3.7.1.4) designed to be physically connected (3.2.3.6) to a vehicle (3.7.1.1) and to remain connected even when the vehicle is not in use

NOTE: Built-in input devices include devices that can be temporarily disconnected (3.7.4.3) for security reasons (e.g. some radios are equipped with detachable front panels).

docs.title: Formalization for built-in vehicle input device
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf vehicleInputDevice

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel built-in input device clause 3.7.1.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel built-in vehicle input device

docs.title: campus
docs.text:
jurisdictional area (3.4.3.4) with a jurisdictional entity (3.4.3.6) who is the owner of the area but excluding transport facilities managed by the local government

NOTE: A campus can be privately or publicly owned.

EXAMPLE: A point of interest (e.g., airport, university, business park, industrial area, shopping centre) that manages its own transport infrastructure separately from that managed by the local government. In this case, the point of interest and its own transport system are a part of the campus.

docs.title: Formalization for campus
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf jurisdictionalArea

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.4.3.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel campus

docs.title: carriageway
docs.text:
contiguous area of paved roadway (3.3.1.3) designed for the use of vehicles along a road segment (3.3.5.8)

NOTE: A carriageway is comprised of one or more traffic lanes (3.3.1.13) [i.e. the usable width (3.3.1.15)] and could include shoulders (3.3.1.18) and lay-bys (3.3.1.16).

docs.title: Formalization for carriageway
docs.text: Property Constraint comprises min 0 owl::Thing comprises min 0 owl::Thing comprises min 0 owl::Thing comprises some usableWidth

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.1.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel carriageway

docs.title: carsharing service
docs.text:
shared vehicle service (3.5.6.3) that shares passenger (3.6.2.1) cars

NOTE: The term "passenger car sharing service" is admitted but has the same meaning.

docs.title: Formalization for carsharing service
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf sharedVehicleService

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.12.2 skos::altLabel passenger car sharing service skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel carsharing service

docs.title: central reservation
docs.text:
part of the road reservation (3.3.1.2) between carriageways (3.3.1.5) designed for travel safety purposes

NOTE: A central reservation can be paved or unpaved and can be equipped with a safety barrier, rails, or other devices.

docs.title: Formalization for central reservation
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf physicalTrafficSeparator

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.2.2 skos::altLabel median skos::altLabel median strip skos::altLabel neutral ground skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel central reservation

docs.title: central system
docs.text: ITS component (3.1.8.2) that provides application, management, and/or administrative functions from a centralized location (3.4.1.1) [i.e. not at the roadside (3.3.1.10)]

docs.title: Formalization for central system
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf itsComponent

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS central system clause 3.2.1.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel central system

docs.title: class
docs.text:
set of ideas, abstractions or things in the real world that are identified with explicit boundaries and meaning and whose properties and behaviour follow the same rules

NOTE: Some ISO/TC 204 documents use the term "object class" for consistency with ISO 11179-1, but within ITS, the term "class" is more generally understood.

docs.title: Formalization for class
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf dataConcept

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.11.2 dcterms::source ISO/IEC 11179-1:2015, 3.3.18, modified - term changed to from "object class" to "class" and Notes to entry added. skos::altLabel object class skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel class

docs.title: commercial
docs.text: type of financial model (3.5.8.1) where services (3.5.1.1) are provided with a profit motive

docs.title: Formalization for commercial
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf financialModel

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.8.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel commercial

docs.title: communications view
docs.text:
architecture view (3.1.3.7) from the communications viewpoint (3.1.4.2)

NOTE: Within ITS, the preferred model for describing the communications view is based on the ITS-S reference architecture (3.1.9.4).

docs.title: Formalization for communications view
docs.text: Property Constraint basedOn some its-sReferenceArchitecture subClassOf architectureView

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.4.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel communications view

docs.title: communications viewpoint
docs.text: architecture viewpoint (3.1.3.6) used to frame concerns (3.1.3.5) related to all layers of the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) stack and related management and security issues

docs.title: Formalization for communications viewpoint
docs.text: Property Constraint governs some communicationsView subClassOf architectureViewpoint

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.4.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel communications viewpoint

docs.title: concern
docs.text:
interest in a system (3.1.2.1) relevant to one or more of its stakeholders (3.1.3.4)

NOTE: A concern pertains to any influence on a system in its environment (3.1.3.11), including developmental, technological, business, operational, organizational, political, economic, legal, regulatory, ecological and social influences.

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel system concern clause 3.1.3.5 dcterms::source ISO/IEC/IEEE 42010:2011, 3.7 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel concern

docs.title: concurrent
docs.text: operational model (3.5.9.1) where services (3.5.1.1) can be provided to multiple users (3.5.1.3) at any one time

docs.title: Formalization for concurrent
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf operationalModel

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.9.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel concurrent

docs.title: connected unit
docs.text: electronic device that is connected (3.2.3.6) using one or more communication media

docs.title: Formalization for connected unit
docs.text: Property Constraint is some connected

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS connected unit clause 3.2.3.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel connected unit

docs.title: connected vehicle roadside equipment
docs.text:
ITS roadside equipment (3.2.3.2) that perform ITS services (3.5.3.1) by exchanging electronic message (3.1.11.5) with nearby connected vehicle (3.2.3.7) and/or personal systems (3.2.1.3) via short-range wireless technologies

NOTE: Connected roadside equipment typically provides ITS-related functionality but the term includes roadside equipment that only provide the ITS service of routing for short-range wireless technologies.

docs.title: Formalization for connected vehicle roadside equipment
docs.text: Property Constraint aggregates min 0 owl::Thing subClassOf itsRoadsideEquipment

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel CV-RSE clause 3.2.3.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel connected vehicle roadside equipment

docs.title: connected vehicle
docs.text: vehicle (3.7.1.1) that is connected (3.2.3.6) using one or more communication media

docs.title: Formalization for connected vehicle
docs.text: Property Constraint is some connected subClassOf vehicle

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.3.7 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel connected vehicle

docs.title: connected
docs.text:
characteristic of a material entity (3.1.1.3) that is equipped with enabled (i.e. on) and operational electronic communication technologies to support ITS services (3.5.3.1), including the means to send and receive data to and from other connected entities

NOTE: The term "connected" does not imply support for any specific communications interface or ITS-S application process (3.2.9.2).

docs.title: Formalization for connected
docs.text: Property Constraint characteristicOf some materialEntity

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS connected clause 3.2.3.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel connected

docs.title: contractual model
docs.text:
legal framework for the agreement between a service provider (3.5.1.2) and a user (3.5.1.3)

NOTE: Contracts can be via a third party, implied or verbal, especially in the case of peer-to-peer (3.5.7.5).

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel shared mobility contract model clause 3.5.7.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel contractual model

docs.title: control
docs.text: measure that is modifying risk (3.1.14.12)

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.14.3 dcterms::source ISO/IEC 27000:2018, 3.14 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel control

docs.title: conventional vehicle
docs.text: vehicle (3.7.1.1) designed to be operated by a person (3.1.1.6) during part or all of every trip.

docs.title: Formalization for conventional vehicle
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf vehicle

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel automation-equipped conventional vehicle clause 3.7.3.14 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel conventional vehicle

docs.title: cooperative ITS credentials management system
docs.text: support system (3.2.1.4) that enables trusted communications among ITS components (3.1.8.2) and protects data from unauthorized access

docs.title: Formalization for cooperative ITS credentials management system
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf supportSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel CCMS clause 3.2.5.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel cooperative ITS credentials management system

docs.title: cooperative ITS
docs.text: subset of ITS (3.1.2.4) where information is shared among ITS stations (3.2.7.3) in a manner that enables its use by multiple ITS services (3.5.3.1)

docs.title: Formalization for cooperative ITS
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf intelligentTransportSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel C-ITS clause 3.1.2.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel cooperative ITS

docs.title: cooperative
docs.text:
type of financial model (3.5.8.1) where users (3.5.1.3) partner to defray the costs of services (3.5.1.1)

NOTE: Cooperative models are exclusive commercial (3.5.8.2) and public (3.5.8.3) models.

docs.title: Formalization for cooperative
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf financialModel

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.8.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel cooperative

docs.title: coordinate tuple
docs.text:
ordered list of numbers that jointly designate the position of a point

NOTE: The number of values in a coordinate tuple is immutable.

docs.title: Formalization for coordinate tuple
docs.text: Property Constraint designates some pointLocation

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.4.1.10 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel coordinate tuple

docs.title: corporate customer model
docs.text:
contractual model (3.5.7.1) where the user (3.5.1.3) is a commercial (3.5.8.2) entity (3.1.1.1)

EXAMPLE: 1 A business purchasing monthly public transport (3.5.6.1) passes for its employees.

docs.title: Formalization for corporate customer model
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf contractualModel

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.7.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel corporate customer model

docs.title: courier network service
docs.text:
commercial (3.5.8.2), peer-to-peer (3.5.7.5) shared transport service (3.5.6.2) that transports goods

NOTE: The goods are typically small packages, letters, food, etc.

docs.title: Formalization for courier network service
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf sharedTransportService

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.11.7 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel courier network service

docs.title: cross-section
docs.text:
transverse view of road (3.3.5.1) geometry

NOTE: The transverse view provides a vertical section of the ground and carriageway (3.3.1.5) at right angles to the centre line of the carriageway.

EXAMPLE: Figure A.28.

docs.title: Formalization for cross-section
docs.text: Property Constraint comprises some roadReservation

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.1.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel cross-section

docs.title: cryptography
docs.text: discipline that embodies the principles, means, and methods for the transformation of data in order to hide their semantic content, prevent their unauthorized use, or prevent their undetected modification

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.14.4 dcterms::source ISO/IEC 22739:2018 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel cryptography

docs.title: cycle lane
docs.text:
lane (3.3.1.12) designed for the through movement of cycles

NOTE: Cycle lanes are typically much narrower than traffic lanes (3.3.1.13).

docs.title: Formalization for cycle lane
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf lane

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.3.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel cycle lane

docs.title: cycleway
docs.text:
infrastructure primarily designed for the use of cycles and separate from a carriageway (3.3.1.5)

NOTE: Local legislation can allow cycleways to be used by a variety of low-speed vehicles (3.7.5.2) (e.g. low-speed scooters, skateboards, etc.) and can share usage of other low-speed modes such as pedestrians (3.6.1.4), horseback riders, etc.

docs.title: Formalization for cycleway
docs.text: Property Constraint comprises some cycleLane

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel cycle track clause 3.3.3.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel cycleway

docs.title: data concept registry
docs.text:
electronic data dictionary (3.1.10.3) that follows precise documented rules for the registration and management of stored data concepts (3.1.10.1)

NOTE: The data concept registry contains meta-attributes (3.1.10.2) about data concepts in terms of their names and representational forms as well as the semantics associated with the data concepts. A data concept registry may contain metadata that assists information interchange and re-use, both from the perspective of human users and for machine-interpretation of data concepts.

docs.title: Formalization for data concept registry
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf dataDictionary

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.10.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel data concept registry

docs.title: data concept
docs.text:
data element (3.1.11.1), class (3.1.11.2), value domain (3.1.11.3), data frame (3.1.11.4), message (3.1.11.5) or interface dialogue (3.1.11.6) defined, at a minimum, with an unambiguous identifier and a definition

NOTE: In order to exchange a value corresponding to a data concept, more information than an identifier, a name and a definition can be needed. For a property, a data type is needed. Depending on the kind of property, other data elements such as unit of measure, and language, can be needed as well. The additional information can be given in the data dictionary (3.1.10.3), in a data specification that references the data concept or associated with the data themselves.

docs.title: Formalization for data concept
docs.text: Property Constraint describes some entity storedIn some dataDictionary

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.10.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel data concept

docs.title: data dictionary
docs.text: collection of data concepts (3.1.10.1) that allows lookup by entity (3.1.1.1) identifier

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.10.3 dcterms::source ISO 22745-2:2010, B.2.16, modified - "collection of data dictionary entries..." replaced with "collection of data concepts...". skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel data dictionary

docs.title: data element
docs.text:
unit of data that is considered in a given context to be indivisible and which includes an unambiguous representational form

NOTE: This definition states that a data element is "indivisible" in a given context. This means it is possible for a data element considered indivisible in one context [e.g. location (3.4.1.1)] to be divisible in another context (e.g. latitude, longitude, and elevation).

docs.title: Formalization for data element
docs.text: Property Constraint describes exactly 1 owl::Thing representedBy exactly 1 owl::Thing subClassOf dataConcept

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.11.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel data element

docs.title: data flow
docs.text: representation of data flowing between two processes (3.1.7.2) or between a process and a terminator (3.1.8.3)

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.7.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel data flow

docs.title: data frame
docs.text:
specific grouping of data elements (3.1.11.1) that describes information of interest through a useful grouping of more atomic properties about one or more classes (3.1.11.2)

NOTE: The grouping can be a set, sequence or a choice.

docs.title: Formalization for data frame
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf dataConcept

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.11.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel data frame

docs.title: data privacy
docs.text: rights and obligations of individuals and organizations with respect to the collection, use, retention, disclosure and disposal of personal information

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.14.5 dcterms::source ISO/IEC 17573-2:2018 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel data privacy

docs.title: deployment architecture
docs.text: architecture (3.1.3.1) that provides a vision of a specific deployment of a system (3.1.2.1) within a geographic area

docs.title: Formalization for deployment architecture
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf architecture

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.9.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel deployment architecture

docs.title: design speed
docs.text:
maximum speed (3.7.2.1) at which a vehicle (3.7.1.1) is intended to operate for a sustained period of time

NOTE: The term "top speed" is defined in SAE J3194 in relation to powered micromobility vehicles and is considered to be semantically equivalent to design speed.

docs.title: Formalization for design speed
docs.text: Property Constraint maximumSustainedSpeedOf exactly 1 owl::Thing

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel vehicle design speed clause 3.7.2.2 skos::altLabel top speed skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel design speed

docs.title: design
docs.text:
the process or the result of the process to define the architecture, system elements, interfaces, and other characteristics of a system or system element

NOTE: Design provides the detailed implementation-level physical structure, behaviour, temporal relationships, and other attributes of system elements. It is information including specification of system elements and their relationships, that is sufficiently complete to support a compliant implementation of the architecture,

EXAMPLE: Example: Complete documentation for building a specific model of a smartphone

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.15.1 dcterms::source ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017, definitions 1 and 2 merged, example added skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel design

docs.title: designated parking space
docs.text:
parking space (3.3.8.3) for a designated purpose Note 1 to entry: Note 2 to entry:

NOTE: The term "designated parking space" is often specialized to indicate the type of designation (e.g., "electric vehicle parking space").

docs.title: Formalization for designated parking space
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf parkingSpace

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.8.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel designated parking space

docs.title: digital signature
docs.text: data appended to a message, that allow the recipient of the message (3.1.11.5) to verify the source of the message

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.14.6 dcterms::source ISO/IEC 2382:2015 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel digital signature

docs.title: disconnected
docs.text:
characteristic of a material entity (3.1.1.3) that is or was equipped with communications equipment that is sufficiently physically disconnected such that the material entity is no longer able to send data to or receive data from connected (3.2.3.6) entities

NOTE: The vehicle on-board equipment can still be present in the vehicle (3.7.1.1) and can even be partially connected, but not in any operational sense.

docs.title: Formalization for disconnected
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf off-grid

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS disconnected clause 3.7.4.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel disconnected

docs.title: document
docs.text:
uniquely identified unit of information for human use

NOTE: A document can be a single information item, or part of a larger information item.

EXAMPLE: A report, specification, manual or book, in printed or electronic form.

docs.title: Formalization for document
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf resource

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.6.3 dcterms::source ISO/IEC/IEEE 15289:2019, 3.1.10 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel document

docs.title: driver support system
docs.text:
driving automation system (3.7.3.6) that is only able to perform part of the DDT (3.7.3.1)

NOTE: Driver support systems include level 1 (3.7.3.8) and level 2 driving automation (3.7.3.9).

docs.title: Formalization for driver support system
docs.text: Property Constraint performsPartOf some dynamicDrivingTask subClassOf drivingAutomationSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.3.7 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel driver support system

docs.title: driver
docs.text:
person (3.1.1.6) that is currently responsible for the dynamic driving task (3.7.3.1) for the vehicle (3.7.1.1)

NOTE: The driver is typically on-board the vehicle but could be remote from the vehicle or automated logic.

docs.title: Formalization for driver
docs.text: Property Constraint isA some person

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.6.2.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel driver

docs.title: driving automation system
docs.text:
hardware and software system (3.1.2.1) that is able to perform part or all of the DDT (3.7.3.1) on a sustained basis

NOTE: In contrast to this generic term for any level 1-5 system, the specific term for a level 3-5 system is "Automated Driving System (ADS)." Given the similarity between the generic term, "driving automation system," and the level 3-5-specific term, "Automated Driving System," the latter term is intentionally capitalized when spelled out and reduced to its acronym, "ADS", as much as possible, while "driving automation system" should not be.

docs.title: Formalization for driving automation system
docs.text: Property Constraint performsPartOrAllOf some dynamicDrivingTask

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.3.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel driving automation system

docs.title: driving space
docs.text:
area above the roadway (3.3.1.3) that is primarily designed for the movement of vehicles (3.7.1.1)

NOTE: In practice, the driving space design considers a variety of issues, which can result in suboptimal road (3.3.5.1) segments that violate normal design guidelines. Such locations (3.4.1.1) are typically posted with warning signs, but they are still designed for the movement of vehicles.

docs.title: Formalization for driving space
docs.text: Property Constraint areaAbove some roadway forMovementOf some vehicle

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.1.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel driving space

docs.title: dual carriageway
docs.text:
having exactly two carriageways (3.3.1.5)

NOTE: The "dual carriageway" term can be used to describe a road, road section, road link, or road segment.

docs.title: Formalization for dual carriageway
docs.text: Property Constraint comprises exactly 2 owl::Thing has exactly 1 owl::Thing subClassOf roadway

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.1.8 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel dual carriageway

docs.title: dual-mode vehicle
docs.text: ADS-equipped vehicle (3.7.3.15) designed for both driverless operation and operation by a conventional driver (3.6.2.4) for complete trips

docs.title: Formalization for dual-mode vehicle
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf ads-equippedVehicle

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel driving automation dual-mode vehicle clause 3.7.3.16 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel dual-mode vehicle

docs.title: duration
docs.text: time between two instants (3.1.13.1)

docs.title: Formalization for duration
docs.text: Property Constraint endsAt exactly 1 owl::Thing startsAt exactly 1 owl::Thing

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.13.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel duration

docs.title: dynamic driving task
docs.text:
all real-time operational and tactical functions required to operate a vehicle (3.7.1.1) in on-road traffic

NOTE: The DDT includes lateral vehicle motion control, longitudinal vehicle motion control, monitoring the driving environment (3.1.3.11), object and event response execution, manoeuvre planning and enhancing conspicuity.

docs.title: Formalization for dynamic driving task
docs.text: Property Constraint isRequiredToOperate some vehicle

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel DDT clause 3.7.3.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel dynamic driving task

docs.title: dynamic route
docs.text:
concurrent (3.5.9.3) operation where transported items can only be received or delivered at stopping points within a pre-defined service (3.5.1.1) corridor

NOTE: The service corridor is defined by the provider, who may impose further restrictions on where stops are allowed.

EXAMPLE: Airport shuttle.

docs.title: Formalization for dynamic route
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf concurrent

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.9.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel dynamic route

docs.title: dynamic spatial reference
docs.text: spatial reference (3.4.2.2) generated on-the-fly based on geographic properties in a digital map database

docs.title: Formalization for dynamic spatial reference
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf spatialReference

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.4.2.3 skos::altLabel dynamic location reference skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel dynamic spatial reference

docs.title: egress lane
docs.text: traffic lane (3.3.1.13) designed for exiting a junction (3.3.6.2)

docs.title: Formalization for egress lane
docs.text: Property Constraint exitFor some junction

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.6.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel egress lane

docs.title: egress link
docs.text: all egress lanes (3.3.6.5) on a road link (3.3.5.6)

docs.title: Formalization for egress link
docs.text: Property Constraint aggregates some egressLane

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.6.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel egress link

docs.title: element
docs.text: component member of an architecture model (3.1.3.9) included in an architecture view (3.1.3.7)

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel architecture element clause 3.1.3.10 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel element

docs.title: emergency management central system
docs.text: centre system (3.2.1.1) that allows an entity (3.1.1.1) to manage and respond to crashes, events, disasters, evacuation orders and other incidents

docs.title: Formalization for emergency management central system
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf centralSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.2.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel emergency management central system

docs.title: enterprise object
docs.text: element (3.1.3.10) within an enterprise view (3.1.4.3) that represents an organization or individual

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.6.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel enterprise object

docs.title: enterprise view
docs.text: architecture view (3.1.3.7) from the enterprise viewpoint (3.1.4.4)

docs.title: Formalization for enterprise view
docs.text: Property Constraint aggregates some enterpriseObject aggregates some resource aggregates some informationFlow aggregates some interaction aggregates some role aggregates some relationship subClassOf architectureView

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.4.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel enterprise view

docs.title: enterprise viewpoint
docs.text: architecture viewpoint (3.1.3.6) used to frame the policies, funding incentives, working arrangements and jurisdictional structure that support the technical layers of the architecture (3.1.3.1)

docs.title: Formalization for enterprise viewpoint
docs.text: Property Constraint governs some enterpriseView subClassOf architectureViewpoint

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.4.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel enterprise viewpoint

docs.title: entity
docs.text:
concrete or abstract thing that exists, did exist, or can possibly exist, including associations among these things

EXAMPLE: Person (3.1.1.6), object, event, idea, process, etc.

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.1.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel entity

docs.title: environment
docs.text:
context determining the setting and circumstances of all influences upon a system (3.1.2.1)

NOTE: The environment of a system includes developmental, technological, business, operational, organizational, political, economic, legal, regulatory, ecological and social influences.

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel system environment clause 3.1.3.11 dcterms::source ISO/IEC/IEEE 42010:2011, 3.8 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel environment

docs.title: escalator
docs.text: rising or falling stairway that assists pedestrians in vertical transitions

docs.title: Formalization for escalator
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf footpath

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.3.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel escalator

docs.title: extend
docs.text:
relationship (3.1.6.8) where one resource (3.1.6.2) supplements another resource

EXAMPLE: A module (3.1.8.7) can extend the functionality of another module.

docs.title: Formalization for extend
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf relationship

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel enterprise view extend clause 3.1.6.10 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel extend

docs.title: facilities layer
docs.text:
communications layer in the ITS station reference architecture (3.1.9.4) corresponding to the session, presentation and application layers of the OSI model

NOTE: Within the US, the NTCIP standards call the facilities layer the "application layer". However, as this term is easily confused with both the OSI application layer and the application entity (3.1.5.1), the term should be avoided and qualified when used (e.g. OSI application layer).

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS-S facilities layer clause 3.1.5.5 skos::hiddenLabel application layer skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel facilities layer

docs.title: fallback-ready user
docs.text: person (3.1.1.6) who is able to operate the vehicle (3.7.1.1) if the Level 3 ADS (3.7.3.11) issues a request to intervene or if that person otherwise identifies a condition that requires intervention to perform the DDT (3.7.3.1)

docs.title: Formalization for fallback-ready user
docs.text: Property Constraint readyToPerform some dynamicDrivingTask

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel DDT fallback-ready user clause 3.7.3.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel fallback-ready user

docs.title: fallback
docs.text:
response by a person (3.1.1.6) to perform the DDT (3.7.3.1) or by an ADS (3.7.3.10) to achieve a minimal risk condition when the response is triggered upon violation of the defined operational design domain (3.7.3.2) constraints or in response to a DDT performance-relevant driving automation system (3.7.3.6) failure

NOTE: This term includes the response of a person to perform the DDT in a manner to quickly achieve a minimal risk condition.

docs.title: Formalization for fallback
docs.text: Property Constraint mayBeCausedBy some ddtPerformance-relevantSystemFailure mayBeCausedByAViolationOf some operationalDesignDomain

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel driving automation fallback clause 3.7.3.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel fallback

docs.title: field support equipment
docs.text: portable field system (3.2.1.2) used by field personnel to locally troubleshoot, initialize, reprogram and test infrastructure equipment

docs.title: Formalization for field support equipment
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf fieldSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS field support equipment clause 3.2.3.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel field support equipment

docs.title: field system
docs.text:
infrastructure-based ITS component (3.1.8.2) located outside of a data centre that is designed to provide local processing or routing services while stationary

NOTE: Typically, field systems are located along the roadside (3.3.1.10).

EXAMPLE: Traffic detector, camera, signal controller, message sign, tolling station.

docs.title: Formalization for field system
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf itsComponent

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS field system altPrefLabel roadside system clause 3.2.1.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel field system

docs.title: financial model
docs.text: economic framework for the agreement between a service provider (3.5.1.2) and a user (3.5.1.3)

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.8.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel financial model

docs.title: fixed route
docs.text:
concurrent (3.5.9.3) operation where transported items can only be received or delivered at stopping points contained in a pre-defined sequence

EXAMPLE: Traditional fixed-route bus line.

docs.title: Formalization for fixed route
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf concurrent

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.9.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel fixed route

docs.title: fleet and freight management central system
docs.text: centre system (3.2.1.1) that allows a fleet or freight operator to manage and control its personnel, equipment and/or freight

docs.title: Formalization for fleet and freight management central system
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf centralSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.2.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel fleet and freight management central system

docs.title: footpath
docs.text:
area designed for the longitudinal movement of pedestrians

NOTE: Regulations typically allow footpaths to be used by other ultra-low speed users (3.5.1.3), such as the users of wheelchairs and strollers.

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.3.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022; revised in 2025 to distinguish between a footpath, which can be crossing areas and footways, which are curvilinear and form lanes. skos::prefLabel footpath

docs.title: formal coordination
docs.text:
interaction (3.1.6.4) between two enterprise objects (3.1.6.1) governed by a documented agreement

EXAMPLE: A road operator can enter into formal agreement(s) with the owner of a road (3.3.5.1) and the owner(s) of the associated roadside (3.3.1.10) equipment.

docs.title: Formalization for formal coordination
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf interaction

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel enterprise view formal coordination clause 3.1.6.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel formal coordination

docs.title: fractional ownership
docs.text: cooperative (3.5.8.4) financial model (3.5.8.1) where users (3.5.1.3) partner to support the purchase, maintenance and overhead costs associated with a service (3.5.1.1)

docs.title: Formalization for fractional ownership
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf cooperative

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.8.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel fractional ownership

docs.title: free-floating
docs.text:
network model (3.5.10.1) where the transport service (3.5.2.1) may be initiated and terminated at any location (3.4.1.1) meeting basic criteria

NOTE: The basic criteria typically include geographic limits and requirements related to legal and safe locations.

docs.title: Formalization for free-floating
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf networkModel

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.10.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel free-floating

docs.title: function
docs.text:
series of actions or activities performed by a given object to achieve a goal

NOTE: A function transforms inputs into outputs that may include the creation, modification, monitoring or destruction of elements (3.1.3.10).

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel functional view function clause 3.1.7.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel function

docs.title: functional object
docs.text:
set of related processes (3.1.7.2) that are performed by a physical object (3.1.8.1) to fulfil aspects of an ITS service (3.5.3.1)

NOTE: The term "module" is used by the European FRAME architecture while the Architecture Reference for Cooperative and Intelligent Transportation (ARC-IT) uses the term "functional object".

EXAMPLE: A vehicle OBE can include a "vehicle basic safety" functional object.

docs.title: Formalization for functional object
docs.text: Property Constraint groups some process subClassOf resource

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS functional object clause 3.1.8.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel functional object

docs.title: functional view
docs.text: architecture view (3.1.3.7) from the functional viewpoint (3.1.4.6)

docs.title: Formalization for functional view
docs.text: Property Constraint aggregates some process aggregates some dataFlow aggregates some processSpecification aggregates some terminator subClassOf architectureView

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.4.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel functional view

docs.title: functional viewpoint
docs.text: architecture viewpoint (3.1.3.6) used to frame concerns (3.1.3.5) related to the definition of processes (3.1.7.2) that perform surface transport functions and data flows (3.1.7.1) shared between these processes

docs.title: Formalization for functional viewpoint
docs.text: Property Constraint governs some functionalView subClassOf architectureViewpoint

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.4.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel functional viewpoint

docs.title: gazetteer
docs.text:
register of spatial references (3.4.2.2) of one or more location (3.4.1.1) sub-types containing some information regarding position

NOTE: The positional information need not be coordinates but could be descriptive.

docs.title: Formalization for gazetteer
docs.text: Property Constraint aggregates some spatialReference

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.4.2.7 dcterms::source ISO 19112:2019, 3.1.1, modified - "register of location instances..." changed to "register of spatial references..." in order to fit the relevant concept model. skos::altLabel location table skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel gazetteer

docs.title: geographic descriptor
docs.text: descriptor that identifies a geographic characteristic to help identify a specific location

docs.title: Formalization for geographic descriptor
docs.text: Property Constraint helpsIdentify some spatialLocation

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.4.2.9 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel geographic descriptor

docs.title: geographic feature
docs.text:
abstraction of real-world phenomena
