NOTE: Geographic features can be defined for any geographic entity that can be defined with geospatial boundaries, such as landmarks, buildings, transport infrastructure (e.g., road, pathway, railway, bridge structures, intersections, traffic signal cabinet, traffic signal pole, waterway), jurisdictional areas (e.g., country, city), etc.

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.4.1.7 dcterms::source ISO 19101-1:2014, 4.1.11, "geographic" has been added to the term to clarify context; note 1 to entry has been replaced. skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel geographic feature

docs.title: geographic identifier
docs.text:
spatial reference (3.4.2.2) in the form of a label or code that identifies a location (3.4.1.1)

NOTE: The term "location code" has been used previously in ISO/TC 204 documents, but "geographic identifier" is preferred to better align with the activities of ISO/TC 211.

EXAMPLE: "Spain" is an example of a label (country name); "SW1P 3AD" is an example of a code (postcode).

docs.title: Formalization for geographic identifier
docs.text: Property Constraint referenceUsedBy some spatialReference

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.4.2.6 dcterms::source ISO 19112:2019, 3.1.2, modified - Note 1 to entry and deprecated term added. skos::hiddenLabel location code skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel geographic identifier

docs.title: geographic point location
docs.text:
well defined geographic place described by one coordinate tuple

NOTE: The "geolocation" term is a short version of the term used within some ITS communities.

docs.title: Formalization for geographic point location
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf pointLocation

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.4.1.4 dcterms::source ISO 19145:2013, 4.1.11, modified - Note 1 to entry added. skos::altLabel geolocation skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel geographic point location

docs.title: government customer model
docs.text:
contractual model (3.5.7.1) where the user (3.5.1.3) is a governmental entity (3.1.1.1)

EXAMPLE: A governmental entity using a commercial (3.5.8.2) courier service for package delivery.

docs.title: Formalization for government customer model
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf contractualModel

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.7.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel government customer model

docs.title: governmental area
docs.text:
transport-related, jurisdictional area (3.4.3.4) whose only jurisdictional entities (3.4.3.6) are governmental entities

NOTE: The boundaries of a jurisdictional area can include or exclude geofenced areas to indicate which jurisdictional entities have authority over transport facilities (3.4.3) as needed.

EXAMPLE: A subway station owned by a governmental entity is a governmental area.

docs.title: Formalization for governmental area
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf jurisdictionalArea

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.4.3.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel governmental area

docs.title: grade separated manoeuvre
docs.text: manoeuvre (3.3.6.7) that is vertically separated from one or more manoeuvres that cross its two-dimensional path

docs.title: Formalization for grade separated manoeuvre
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf intersectionManoeuvre

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.6.10 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel grade separated manoeuvre

docs.title: gross vehicle mass rating
docs.text: maximum operating mass (weight) of the vehicle, as determined by the vehicle manufacturer, at which the vehicle can be safely and reliably operated for its intended purpose

docs.title: Formalization for gross vehicle mass rating
docs.text: Property Constraint maxOperatingWeightFor exactly 1 owl::Thing

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.2.10 skos::altLabel gross vehicle weight rating skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel gross vehicle mass rating

docs.title: gross vehicle mass
docs.text: operating mass (weight) of the vehicle according to legislation and/or regulations for the applicable region Note 1 to entry: Gross vehicle mass is often used to designate weight limits (e.g., on bridges).

docs.title: Formalization for gross vehicle mass
docs.text: Property Constraint operatingMassOf exactly 1 owl::Thing

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.2.9 skos::altLabel gross vehicle weight skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel gross vehicle mass

docs.title: hard shoulder for emergency use
docs.text: operating mode of a hard shoulder (3.3.1.19) that allows operation of emergency, construction, maintenance, or other special use vehicles (3.7.1.1) or for emergency stopping and is prohibited for other vehicle usage

docs.title: Formalization for hard shoulder for emergency use
docs.text: Property Constraint operatingModeOf some hardShoulder

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.4.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel hard shoulder for emergency use

docs.title: hard shoulder running
docs.text: operating mode of a hard shoulder (3.3.1.19) that allows operation of general-purpose motor vehicles (3.7.6.3) as an extra lane (3.3.1.12)

docs.title: Formalization for hard shoulder running
docs.text: Property Constraint operatingModeOf some hardShoulder

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.4.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel hard shoulder running

docs.title: hard shoulder
docs.text:
part of the paved carriageway (3.3.1.5) designed to support traffic loads but not normally intended for driving

NOTE: A hard shoulder can be narrow or wide enough for a traffic lane (3.3.1.13).

docs.title: Formalization for hard shoulder
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf shoulder

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.1.19 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel hard shoulder

docs.title: hardstanding
docs.text:
part of a paved carriageway (3.3.1.5) that is not a traffic lane (3.3.1.13), hard shoulder (3.3.1.19), or lay-by (3.3.1.16).

NOTE: Hardstanding can include edges of a hard shoulder outside of designated lane markings, slips for future connector roads (3.3.5.1), etc.

EXAMPLE: See Figure A.23.

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.1.17 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel hardstanding

docs.title: high vehicle speed
docs.text:
speed (3.7.2.1) of a vehicle (3.7.1.1) that exceeds free flow motorway speeds by a factor of two or more

NOTE: Local regulations for the exact speed range vary.

EXAMPLE: A speed in excess of 198 km/h.

docs.title: Formalization for high vehicle speed
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf speed

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.5.12 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel high vehicle speed

docs.title: high-speed vehicle
docs.text:
vehicle (3.7.1.1) with a design speed (3.7.2.2) in the range of high vehicle speeds (3.7.5.12)

EXAMPLE: 1 Racing car.

docs.title: Formalization for high-speed vehicle
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf vehicle

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.5.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel high-speed vehicle

docs.title: immaterial entity
docs.text:
entity (3.1.1.1) that does not occupy three-dimensional space

EXAMPLE: Idea, process, organization, etc.

docs.title: Formalization for immaterial entity
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf entity

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.1.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel immaterial entity

docs.title: implementation
docs.text:
the process or the result of the process of translating a design into hardware components, software components, or both

NOTE: An implementation is the conceptual set of all instances of a product resulting from the translation. The set of all instances can consist of a single instance.

EXAMPLE: Example: The process of building a specific model of a smartphone or the resultant model of smartphone

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.15.2 dcterms::source ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017, definitions 1 and 2 merged with example and note added skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel implementation

docs.title: in-vehicle driver
docs.text: driver (3.6.2.3) that performs the dynamic driving task (3.7.3.1) using the vehicle's (3.7.1.1) built-in input devices (3.7.1.5) to control the longitudinal and lateral movement of the vehicle

docs.title: Formalization for in-vehicle driver
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf driver uses some built-inVehicleInputDevice

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel conventional driver clause 3.6.2.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel in-vehicle driver

docs.title: include
docs.text:
relationship (3.1.6.8) where one resource (3.1.6.2) contains another resource

EXAMPLE: Every ITS component includes one or more modules (3.1.8.7).

docs.title: Formalization for include
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf relationship

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel enterprise view include clause 3.1.6.9 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel include

docs.title: informal coordination
docs.text: interaction (3.1.6.4) between two enterprise objects (3.1.6.1) governed by an understanding that is not documented in a formal agreement between the two parties

docs.title: Formalization for informal coordination
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf interaction

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel enterprise view informal coordination clause 3.1.6.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel informal coordination

docs.title: information flow
docs.text: information that is exchanged between physical objects (3.1.8.1)

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.8.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel information flow

docs.title: information security event
docs.text: occurrence indicating a possible breach of information security or failure of controls (3.1.14.3)

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.14.7 dcterms::source ISO/IEC 27035-1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel information security event

docs.title: information security incident
docs.text: related and identified information security event(s) (3.1.14.7) that can harm an organization's assets or compromise its operations

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.14.8 dcterms::source ISO/IEC 27035-1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel skos::prefLabel information security incident

docs.title: information transfer
docs.text:
information flow (3.1.8.4) from a physical object (3.1.8.1) acting as an information provider and sent to another physical object acting as an information consumer

NOTE: The term "information flow triple" is used extensively in the Architecture Reference for Cooperative and Intelligent Transportation (ARC-IT; see Reference [25]).

docs.title: Formalization for information transfer
docs.text: Property Constraint contentsOf some informationFlow sentFrom some physicalObject sentTo some physicalObject

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.8.5 skos::altLabel information flow triple skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel information transfer

docs.title: infrastructure descriptor
docs.text: descriptor that identifies infrastructure to help identify a specific location

docs.title: Formalization for infrastructure descriptor
docs.text: Property Constraint helpsIdentify some transportFacility

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.4.2.10 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel infrastructure descriptor

docs.title: ingress lane
docs.text: traffic lane (3.3.1.13) designed for entering a junction (3.3.6.2)

docs.title: Formalization for ingress lane
docs.text: Property Constraint entryFor some junction

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.6.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ingress lane

docs.title: ingress link
docs.text: all ingress lanes (3.3.6.3) on a road link (3.3.5.6)

docs.title: Formalization for ingress link
docs.text: Property Constraint aggregates some ingressLane

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.6.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ingress link

docs.title: instance
docs.text:
discrete, bounded object with an intrinsic, immutable, and unique identity

NOTE: An instance of an implementation can also be called a physical instantiation, in the case of a hardware component.

EXAMPLE: Example: A specific smartphone (e.g., having a unique serial number)

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.15.3 dcterms::source ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017, definition 1, example and note added skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel instance

docs.title: instant
docs.text: 0-dimensional geometric primitive representing position in time

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.13.1 dcterms::source ISO 19108:2002, 4.1.17, modified - Note 1 to entry removed. skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel instant

docs.title: intelligent transport system
docs.text:
system (3.1.2.1) comprised of information, communication, sensor and control technologies and that is designed to benefit a surface transport system (3.1.2.3)

NOTE: "Intelligent transportation system" is the American English equivalent.

docs.title: Formalization for intelligent transport system
docs.text: Property Constraint designedToBenefit some surfaceTransportSystem subClassOf system

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS clause 3.1.2.4 skos::altLabel intelligent transportation system skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel intelligent transport system

docs.title: interaction
docs.text: element (3.1.3.10) that represents coordination between two enterprise objects (3.1.6.1)

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel enterprise view interaction clause 3.1.6.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel interaction

docs.title: interchange
docs.text:
junction (3.3.6.2) with at least one grade separated manoeuvre (3.3.6.10)

NOTE: The term "interchange" typically refers to the facilities that enable all available manoeuvres at the grade separated intersection (3.3.6.1), which typically includes multiple junctions.

docs.title: Formalization for interchange
docs.text: Property Constraint aggregates some gradeSeparatedManoeuvre subClassOf junction

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.6.9 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel interchange

docs.title: interface dialogue
docs.text:
bi-directional communication sequence between two parties in accordance with predetermined protocols

NOTE: The term "dialog" represents the American English spelling.

docs.title: Formalization for interface dialogue
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf dataConcept uses some message

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.11.6 skos::altLabel dialog skos::altLabel dialogue skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel interface dialogue

docs.title: interoperability design
docs.text:
characteristics necessary to fully define how various physical objects (3.1.8.1) interoperate to provide a service (3.5.1.1)

NOTE: Characteristics often include but are not limited to functional, performance and interface requirements.

docs.title: Formalization for interoperability design
docs.text: Property Constraint definesHowToProvide some service using some physicalObject

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.8.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel interoperability design

docs.title: intersection manoeuvre
docs.text:
movement from an ingress lane (3.3.6.3) to an egress lane (3.3.6.5)

NOTE: The term "maneuver" is the American English spelling.

docs.title: Formalization for intersection manoeuvre
docs.text: Property Constraint from some ingressLane to some egressLane

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel manoeuvre clause 3.3.6.7 skos::altLabel maneuver skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel intersection manoeuvre

docs.title: intersection
docs.text:
space where two or more roads (3.3.5.1) meet or cross

NOTE: Intersections can be associated with zero junctions (3.3.6.2), such as a motorway crossing a road without any connecting ramps, or can be associated with one or more junctions, such as a diamond interchange (3.3.6.9).

docs.title: Formalization for intersection
docs.text: Property Constraint meetingOrCrossing min 2 owl::Thing

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.6.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel intersection

docs.title: junction at grade
docs.text: junction (3.3.6.2) without any grade separated manoeuvres (3.3.6.10)

docs.title: Formalization for junction at grade
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf junction

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel at-grade intersection clause 3.3.6.8 skos::altLabel grade junction skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel junction at grade

docs.title: Formalization for junction
docs.text: Property Constraint aggregates some ingressLane aggregates some egressLane subClassOf intersection

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.6.2 skos::altLabel skos::altLabel intersection (3.3.6.1) that allows travellers (3.6.1.1) to change roads (3.3.5.1) skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel junction

docs.title: jurisdiction
docs.text: legal power to issue rules of behaviour for a defined area

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.4.3.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel jurisdiction

docs.title: jurisdictional area
docs.text:
territory for which a jurisdictional entity (3.4.3.6) has the power to define rules of behaviour

NOTE: A jurisdictional area might include non-contiguous locations.

docs.title: Formalization for jurisdictional area
docs.text: Property Constraint rulesDefinedBy some jurisdictionalEntity

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.4.3.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel jurisdictional area

docs.title: jurisdictional boundary
docs.text:
territorial limit associated with a jurisdictional area (3.4.3.5)

NOTE: A geofence can be used to electronically represent a jurisdictional boundary.

docs.title: Formalization for jurisdictional boundary
docs.text: Property Constraint limitOf some jurisdictionalArea

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.4.3.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel jurisdictional boundary

docs.title: jurisdictional entity
docs.text:
person (3.1.1.6) or organization who has jurisdiction (3.4.3.3)

NOTE: In the case of a geopolitical jurisdiction, the jurisdictional entity is typically the recognized government for the territory; in the case of a campus, the jurisdictional entity is typically the landowner.

EXAMPLE: A city government

docs.title: Formalization for jurisdictional entity
docs.text: Property Constraint has some jurisdiction

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.4.3.7 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel jurisdictional entity

docs.title: kerb
docs.text: physical traffic separator, usually upstanding, at the edge of a carriageway, hard strip, hard shoulder, or footway Note 1 to entry: "Curb" is the US spelling.

docs.title: Formalization for kerb
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf physicalTrafficSeparator

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.2.4 skos::altLabel curb skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel kerb

docs.title: lane link
docs.text:
link (3.3.5.5) that represents a lane (3.3.1.12) of a road link (3.3.5.6)

NOTE: A lane segment (3.3.5.10) can start or end at locations (3.4.1.1) other than the start or end of the corresponding road segment (3.3.5.8) (e.g. a lane can start mid-block).

docs.title: Formalization for lane link
docs.text: Property Constraint constitutes some laneSegment subClassOf link

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.5.9 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel lane link

docs.title: lane segment
docs.text: link (3.3.5.1) that represents a contiguous length of a lane link (3.3.5.9) characterized by the same physical characteristics

docs.title: Formalization for lane segment
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf link

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.5.10 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel lane segment

docs.title: lane
docs.text:
portion of road reservation (3.3.1.2) intended to accommodate a single line of moving material entities (3.1.1.3) along its length

NOTE: Lanes (3.3.1.12) are often bounded by lane markings.

EXAMPLE: Traffic lane (3.3.1.13), cycle lane (3.3.3.1), sidewalk (3.3.3.4).

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel generic lane clause 3.3.1.12 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel lane

docs.title: lay-by
docs.text:
short length of paved carriageway (3.3.1.5) at its edge designed to allow a vehicle (3.7.1.1) to draw out of the traffic lanes (3.3.1.13) and stop temporarily

NOTE: Lay-bys are not part of a hard shoulder (3.3.1.19).

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.1.16 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel lay-by

docs.title: level 1 driving automation
docs.text:
driver support system (3.7.3.7) that provides either sustained lateral or sustained longitudinal vehicle (3.7.1.1) motion control within a specific operational design domain (3.7.3.2) with the expectation that a conventional driver (3.6.2.4) completes the DDT (3.7.3.1)

NOTE: Other driving automation levels include "level 2 driving automation" (3.7.3.9), "level 3 ADS" (3.7.3.11), "level 4 ADS" (3.7.3.12), and "level 5 ADS" (3.7.3.13).

docs.title: Formalization for level 1 driving automation
docs.text: Property Constraint operatesWithinA some operationalDesignDomain subClassOf driverSupportSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel driver assistance clause 3.7.3.8 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel level 1 driving automation

docs.title: level 2 driving automation
docs.text:
driver support system (3.7.3.7) that provides sustained lateral and longitudinal vehicle (3.7.1.1) motion control within a specific operational design domain (3.7.3.2) with the expectation that a conventional driver (3.6.2.4) completes the object and event detection and response

NOTE: Other driving automation levels include "level 1 driving automation" (3.7.3.8), "level 3 ADS" (3.7.3.11), "level 4 ADS" (3.7.3.12), and "level 5 ADS" (3.7.3.13).

docs.title: Formalization for level 2 driving automation
docs.text: Property Constraint operatesWithinA some operationalDesignDomain subClassOf driverSupportSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel partial driving automation clause 3.7.3.9 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel level 2 driving automation

docs.title: level 3 ADS
docs.text:
ADS (3.7.3.10) designed with the expectation that the fallback-ready user (3.7.3.4) is available to intervene

NOTE: Level 3 ADSs are restricted to operating within a specific ODD (3.7.3.2).

docs.title: Formalization for level 3 ADS
docs.text: Property Constraint designedWithExpectationOf some fallback-readyUser operatesWithinA some operationalDesignDomain subClassOf ads

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel conditional driving automation altPrefLabel level 3 Automated Driving System clause 3.7.3.11 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel level 3 ADS

docs.title: level 4 ADS
docs.text:
ADS (3.7.3.10) that is capable of operating within a specific ODD (3.7.3.2) and providing its own fallback (3.7.3.3), without any expectation that a human driver (3.6.2.3) will respond to a request to intervene

NOTE: Other driving automation levels include "level 1 driving automation" (3.7.3.8), "level 2 driving automation" (3.7.3.9), "level 3 ADS" (3.7.3.11), and "level 5 ADS" (3.7.3.13).

docs.title: Formalization for level 4 ADS
docs.text: Property Constraint operatesWithinA some operationalDesignDomain providesItsOwn some fallback subClassOf ads

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel high driving automation altPrefLabel level 4 Automated Driving System clause 3.7.3.12 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel level 4 ADS

docs.title: level 5 ADS
docs.text:
ADS (3.7.3.10) that is capable of unconditional (i.e. not ODD (3.7.3.2)-specific) operation and providing its own fallback (3.7.3.3), without any expectation that a human driver (3.6.2.3) will respond to a request to intervene

NOTE: Other driving automation levels include "level 1 driving automation" (3.7.3.8), "level 2 driving automation" (3.7.3.9), "level 3 ADS" (3.7.3.11) and "level 4 ADS" (3.7.3.12).

docs.title: Formalization for level 5 ADS
docs.text: Property Constraint operatesWithinA some operationalDesignDomain providesItsOwn some fallback subClassOf ads

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel full driving automation altPrefLabel level 5 Automated Driving System clause 3.7.3.13 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel level 5 ADS

docs.title: linear location
docs.text:
spatial location (3.4.1.2) that extends between two point locations (3.4.1.3) along a defined path

NOTE: The path can exhibit 3-dimensional characteristics.

docs.title: Formalization for linear location
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf spatialLocation

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS linear location clause 3.4.1.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel linear location

docs.title: link location
docs.text: pre-coded spatial reference (3.4.2.4) defined within the road network (3.3.5.2) database

docs.title: Formalization for link location
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf pre-codedSpatialReference

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.4.2.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel link location

docs.title: link
docs.text:
component of a road model (3.3.5.3) that represents a connection between two nodes (3.3.5.4)

NOTE: A link can be curvilinear and can have various attributes such as width.

docs.title: Formalization for link
docs.text: Property Constraint connects exactly 2 owl::Thing

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.5.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel link

docs.title: loading area
docs.text:
area designated for vehicles (3.7.1.1) to load and/or unload goods

NOTE: The area can include the vehicle waiting area and the goods waiting area.

docs.title: Formalization for loading area
docs.text: Property Constraint forDesignated some vehicles

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel unloading area clause 3.3.8.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel loading area

docs.title: location referencing
docs.text: process used to develop a spatial reference (3.4.2.2)

docs.title: Formalization for location referencing
docs.text: Property Constraint processToDevelop some spatialReference

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS location referencing clause 3.4.2.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel location referencing

docs.title: location
docs.text:
particular place or position

NOTE: The term "location" by itself is a broad term that can be used to reference spatial, computer memory, imaginary and other locations.

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.4.1.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel location

docs.title: low vehicle speed
docs.text:
speed (3.7.2.1) of a vehicle (3.7.1.1) that exceeds pedestrian (3.6.1.4) speeds and is more typical of pedal cycles

NOTE: Local regulations for the exact speed range vary.

EXAMPLE: SAE J3194 associates this with a top speed in the range between 13 km/h and 32 km/h.

docs.title: Formalization for low vehicle speed
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf speed

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.5.8 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel low vehicle speed

docs.title: low-speed vehicle
docs.text:
vehicle (3.7.1.1) with a design speed (3.7.2.2) in the range of low vehicle speeds (3.7.5.8)

NOTE: The term "cycle-speed vehicle" is allowed but the preferred term follows a logical progression of levels.

EXAMPLE: Mountain bicycle.

docs.title: Formalization for low-speed vehicle
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf vehicle

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.5.2 skos::altLabel cycle-speed vehicle skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel low-speed vehicle

docs.title: maintenance and construction central management system
docs.text: centre system (3.2.1.1) that allows an entity (3.1.1.1) to monitor and manage the construction and maintenance of road (3.3.5.1) infrastructure

docs.title: Formalization for maintenance and construction central management system
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf centralSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.2.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel maintenance and construction central management system

docs.title: management entity
docs.text: part of the ITS station reference architecture (3.1.9.4) that is responsible for management and configuration of all layers and entities within the ITS-S

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS-S management entity clause 3.1.5.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel management entity

docs.title: map provision system
docs.text: support system (3.2.1.4) that provides map databases used to support ITS services (3.5.3.1)

docs.title: Formalization for map provision system
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf supportSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS map provision system clause 3.2.5.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel map provision system

docs.title: material entity
docs.text:
entity (3.1.1.1) that occupies three-dimensional space

NOTE: All material entities have certain characteristics that can be described and therefore this concept is important for ontology purposes.

docs.title: Formalization for material entity
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf entity

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.1.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel material entity

docs.title: membership-based
docs.text:
characteristic of a financial model (3.5.8.1) that requires users (3.5.1.3) to enter into an agreement prior to receiving services (3.5.1.1)

NOTE: The agreement can be associated with fees.

docs.title: Formalization for membership-based
docs.text: Property Constraint describes some financialModel

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.8.8 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel membership-based

docs.title: message
docs.text: grouping of data elements (3.1.11.1), data frames (3.1.11.4), or data elements and data frames that is used to convey information

docs.title: Formalization for message
docs.text: Property Constraint contains min 0 owl::Thing contains min 0 owl::Thing subClassOf dataConcept

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.11.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel message

docs.title: meta-attribute
docs.text: documenting characteristic of a data concept (3.1.10.1) that is stored in a data dictionary (3.1.10.3)

docs.title: Formalization for meta-attribute
docs.text: Property Constraint characteristicOf some dataConcept

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.10.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel meta-attribute

docs.title: mobility app
docs.text: ITS-S application implementation (3.2.9.4) designed to assist an individual transport consumer in understanding transport-related information, making decisions, and/or acting upon decisions

docs.title: Formalization for mobility app
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf its-sApplicationImplementation

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.5.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel mobility app

docs.title: model kind
docs.text:
conventions for a type of modelling

NOTE: Examples of model kinds include data flow (3.1.7.1) diagrams, class (3.1.11.2) diagrams, Petri nets, balance sheets, organization charts and state transition models.

docs.title: Formalization for model kind
docs.text: Property Constraint governs some architectureModel

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.3.8 dcterms::source ISO/IEC/IEEE 42010:2011, 3.9 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel model kind

docs.title: moderate vehicle speed
docs.text:
speed (3.7.2.1) of a vehicle (3.7.1.1) that exceeds moderately-low vehicle speeds (3.7.5.9) but does not reach free-flow motorway speeds

NOTE: Local regulations for the exact speed range vary.

EXAMPLE: A speed in the range of 48 km/h and 87 km/h.

docs.title: Formalization for moderate vehicle speed
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf speed

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.5.10 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel moderate vehicle speed

docs.title: moderate-speed vehicle
docs.text:
vehicle (3.7.1.1) with a design speed (3.7.2.2) in the range of moderate vehicle speeds (3.7.5.10)

EXAMPLE: Typical side-by-side utility task vehicle (UTV).

docs.title: Formalization for moderate-speed vehicle
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf vehicle

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.5.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel moderate-speed vehicle

docs.title: moderately high-speed vehicle
docs.text:
vehicle (3.7.1.1) with a design speed (3.7.2.2) in the range of moderately-high vehicle speeds (3.7.5.11)

EXAMPLE: Typical passenger (3.6.2.1) car.

docs.title: Formalization for moderately high-speed vehicle
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf vehicle

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.5.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel moderately high-speed vehicle

docs.title: moderately low-speed vehicle
docs.text:
vehicle (3.7.1.1) with a design speed (3.7.2.2) in the range of moderately-low vehicle speeds (3.7.5.9)

EXAMPLE: Typical moped.

docs.title: Formalization for moderately low-speed vehicle
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf vehicle

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.5.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel moderately low-speed vehicle

docs.title: moderately-high vehicle speed
docs.text:
speed (3.7.2.1) of a vehicle (3.7.1.1) that is typical of free-flow motorway speeds to twice that speed

NOTE: Local regulations for the exact speed range vary.

EXAMPLE: A speed in the range of 87 km/h and 198 km/h.

docs.title: Formalization for moderately-high vehicle speed
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf speed

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.5.11 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel moderately-high vehicle speed

docs.title: moderately-low vehicle speed
docs.text:
speed (3.7.2.1) of a vehicle (3.7.1.1) that exceeds speeds typical of pedal cycles but can be reached on performance pedal cycles in short bursts or by performance riders

NOTE: Local regulations for the exact speed range vary.

EXAMPLE: SAE J3194 associates this with a top speed in the range of 32 km/h to 48 km/h.

docs.title: Formalization for moderately-low vehicle speed
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf speed

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.5.9 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel moderately-low vehicle speed

docs.title: module
docs.text: functional object (3.1.8.6) that can be replaced and has defined interfaces

docs.title: Formalization for module
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf functionalObject

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS module clause 3.1.8.7 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel module

docs.title: motor vehicle
docs.text: motorized (3.7.6.2) road vehicle (3.7.6.1) allowed to operate in the same driving spaces (3.3.1.4) as motorized passenger (3.6.2.1) cars

docs.title: Formalization for motor vehicle
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf roadVehicle subClassOf motorizedVehicle

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.6.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel motor vehicle

docs.title: motor
docs.text: material entity (3.1.1.3) that converts energy into mechanical motion

docs.title: Formalization for motor
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf materialEntity

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.1.2 skos::altLabel engine skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel motor

docs.title: motorized vehicle
docs.text: self-propelled vehicle (3.7.1.1)

docs.title: Formalization for motorized vehicle
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf vehicle

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.6.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel motorized vehicle

docs.title: motorway
docs.text:
road (3.3.5.1) with separate carriageways for each direction, with limited access that prevents cross traffic on the same level, and for the exclusive use of certain classes of motor vehicles

NOTE: The terms "interstate highway" and "freeway" are US terms.

docs.title: Formalization for motorway
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf road

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.1.21 skos::altLabel freeway skos::altLabel interstate highway skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel motorway

docs.title: movable bridge
docs.text:
bridge (3.3.7.3) with a deck that can be moved in a way that disrupts the continuous travel path

NOTE: Movable bridges can be used over waterways to allow for the passage of tall ships.

docs.title: Formalization for movable bridge
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf bridge

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.7.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel movable bridge

docs.title: moving walkway
docs.text: footpath consisting of a conveyor belt for pedestrians Note 1 to entry: Moving walkways are often used in airports with long footpaths Note 2 to entry: Moving walkways assist pedestrians in traversing longer distances. Note 3 to entry: "Travellator" is a term used in Singapore.

docs.title: Formalization for moving walkway
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf footpath

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.3.6 skos::altLabel travellator skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel moving walkway

docs.title: multiple carriageway
docs.text:
having more than one carriageway (3.3.1.5)

NOTE: The "multiple carriageway" term can be used to describe a road, road section, road link, or road segment.

docs.title: Formalization for multiple carriageway
docs.text: Property Constraint comprises min 3 owl::Thing has min 2 owl::Thing subClassOf roadway

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.1.9 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel multiple carriageway

docs.title: mutual benefit
docs.text: cooperative (3.5.8.4) financial model (3.5.8.1) where users (3.5.1.3) partner on a per-use basis

docs.title: Formalization for mutual benefit
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf cooperative

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.8.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel mutual benefit

docs.title: navigation app
docs.text: mobility app (3.5.13.1) that assists a transport user (3.5.2.3) to determine the best route to a destination

docs.title: Formalization for navigation app
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf mobilityApp

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.5.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel navigation app

docs.title: network location
docs.text: point or linear location on a network

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.4.2.8 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel network location

docs.title: network model
docs.text: infrastructure framework for the agreement between a service provider (3.5.1.2) and a user (3.5.1.3)

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.10.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel network model

docs.title: node
docs.text:
component of a road model (3.3.5.3) representing a point location (3.4.1.3) of the road network (3.3.5.2) graph

NOTE: The point location typically represents a point along the road (3.3.5.1) which can be used to designate the location (3.4.1.1) of a junction (3.3.6.2), public transport (3.5.6.1) stop, jurisdictional boundary, termination point, etc.

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel road network node clause 3.3.5.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel node

docs.title: nomadic device
docs.text:
personal information device (3.2.4.2) that is taken with and can be accessed by the traveller (3.6.1.1) during a journey

EXAMPLE: Smartphone.

docs.title: Formalization for nomadic device
docs.text: Property Constraint accessedBy min 0 owl::Thing subClassOf personalInformationDevice

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS nomadic device clause 3.2.4.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel nomadic device

docs.title: nomadic vehicle device
docs.text: personal system (3.2.1.3) consisting of global navigation satellite system (GNSS) and/or wireless modules (3.1.8.7) that are connected (3.2.3.6) to a vehicle (3.7.1.1) during a trip

docs.title: Formalization for nomadic vehicle device
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf personalSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel carry-in vehicle device clause 3.2.4.1 skos::altLabel external in-vehicle device skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel nomadic vehicle device

docs.title: nomadic vehicle input device
docs.text:
input device (3.7.1.4) that can be carried into, or in near proximity of, a vehicle (3.7.1.1) and connected (3.2.3.6) as desired

NOTE: NDs are often more closely associated with a person (3.1.1.6) than they are with the vehicle.

EXAMPLE: A smartphone connected to a vehicle (via USB or Bluetooth) to provide driver (3.6.2.3) navigation on the vehicle's large screen display

docs.title: Formalization for nomadic vehicle input device
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf vehicleInputDevice

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel nomadic input device clause 3.7.1.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel nomadic vehicle input device

docs.title: non-biological entity
docs.text: material entity (3.1.1.3) that is not and has never been a living organism

docs.title: Formalization for non-biological entity
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf materialEntity

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.1.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel non-biological entity

docs.title: non-repudiation
docs.text: ability to prove the occurrence of a claimed event or action and its originating entities

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.14.9 dcterms::source ISO/IEC 27000:2018, 3.48 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel non-repudiation

docs.title: non-road cycle
docs.text: human-powered vehicle (3.7.1.1) not meeting the legal requirements to be driven in cycle lanes (3.3.3.1)

docs.title: Formalization for non-road cycle
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf vehicle

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.6.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel non-road cycle

docs.title: non-road vehicle
docs.text: vehicle (3.7.1.1) not meeting the legal requirements to be driven in traffic lanes (3.3.1.13) or cycle lanes (3.3.3.1) of a road network (3.3.5.2)

docs.title: Formalization for non-road vehicle
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf vehicle

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.6.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel non-road vehicle

docs.title: objective
docs.text: result to be achieved

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.14.10 dcterms::source ISO/IEC 27000:2018, 3.49 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel objective

docs.title: off-grid
docs.text: characteristic of a material entity (3.1.1.3) that is currently unable to send data to or receive data from connected (3.2.3.6) entities

docs.title: Formalization for off-grid
docs.text: Property Constraint characteristicOf some materialEntity

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS off-grid clause 3.7.4.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel off-grid

docs.title: open-access
docs.text:
characteristic of a financial model (3.5.8.1) that does not require membership within an organization to receive services (3.5.1.1)

NOTE: This includes models where membership is optional and can provide extra benefits.

docs.title: Formalization for open-access
docs.text: Property Constraint describes some financialModel

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.8.9 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel open-access

docs.title: operational design domain
docs.text:
set of operating conditions under which a given driving automation system (3.7.3.6) or feature thereof is specifically designed to function

NOTE: The conditions can include environmental, geographical, time-of-day, and/or other restrictions.

EXAMPLE: 1 ADS (3.7.3.10) feature designed to operate a vehicle (3.7.1.1) only on fully access-controlled freeways in low-speed traffic, under fair weather conditions and optimal road (3.3.5.1) maintenance conditions (e.g. good lane markings and not under construction).

docs.title: Formalization for operational design domain
docs.text: Property Constraint forAGiven some drivingAutomationSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ODD clause 3.7.3.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel operational design domain

docs.title: operational model
docs.text:
logistical framework for the agreement between a service provider (3.5.1.2) and a user (3.5.1.3)

NOTE: The logistical framework can set restrictions on how a passenger (3.6.2.1) and/or good is received, transported and/or delivered.

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.9.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel operational model

docs.title: organization
docs.text:
immaterial entity (3.1.1.2) that is a structured group of one or more agents

EXAMPLE: Company, government agency, non-governmental organization, etc.

docs.title: Formalization for organization
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf immaterialEntity

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value order 7

docs.title: paired on-demand
docs.text:
concurrent (3.5.9.3) operation where the transport provider (3.5.2.2) may choose to divert from its path to service a new request from another transport users (3.5.2.3) while servicing an earlier transport user

EXAMPLE: Ridesplitting.

docs.title: Formalization for paired on-demand
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf concurrent

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.9.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel paired on-demand

docs.title: parking space for permit holders
docs.text:
designated parking space (3.3.8.3) that requires a special permit from an appropriate authority

NOTE: The permit can be physically displayed or linked to a database, per authority policies.

docs.title: Formalization for parking space for permit holders
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf designatedParkingSpace

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.8.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel parking space for permit holders

docs.title: parking space
docs.text: location for storing a vehicle (3.7.1.1) Note 1 to entry: The vehicle can be a motor vehicle, cycle, or any other type of vehicle. Note 2 to entry: A parking space is usually designed for a single vehicle. Note 3 to entry: Parking spaces can be, but are not necessarily, denoted by painted or other road surface markings.

docs.title: Formalization for parking space
docs.text: Property Constraint store max 1 owl::Thing

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.8.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel parking space

docs.title: passenger
docs.text: person (3.1.1.6) who has a reservation to travel or is travelling in a vehicle (3.7.1.1) except for any crew, staff or drivers (3.6.2.3)

docs.title: Formalization for passenger
docs.text: Property Constraint isA some person travellingIn some vehicle

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.6.2.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel passenger

docs.title: payment administration central system
docs.text: centre system (3.2.1.1) that allows an entity (3.1.1.1) to manage financial transactions related to transportation, especially the electronic transfer of funds

docs.title: Formalization for payment administration central system
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf centralSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.2.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel payment administration central system

docs.title: payment means
docs.text:
financial instrument accepted by the service provider, that gives the user the right to use provided services

EXAMPLE: token, stored electronic account, fleet card, bank account, credit card, contract

docs.title: Formalization for payment means
docs.text: Property Constraint acceptedBy some serviceProvider

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.8.1.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel payment means

docs.title: payment mode
docs.text:
timing and location of remuneration for services including whether the payment is required prior to, at the time of or post access to the service or commodity

EXAMPLE: pre-payment

docs.title: Formalization for payment mode
docs.text: Property Constraint timingAndLocationOfRemunerationTo some serviceProvider

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.8.1.2 skos::altLabel payment method skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel payment mode

docs.title: pedestrian crossing
docs.text:
physically marked location to enhance the safety of pedestrians crossing one or more lanes of a different mode of travel

NOTE: Pedestrian permission and/or priority at crossing can be managed when traffic signals are present.

docs.title: Formalization for pedestrian crossing
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf footpath

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel crosswalk clause 3.3.3.7 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel pedestrian crossing

docs.title: pedestrian
docs.text: person (3.1.1.6) who is travelling on foot

docs.title: Formalization for pedestrian
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf traveller

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.6.1.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel pedestrian

docs.title: peer-to-peer
docs.text:
private customer model (3.5.7.3) where the service provider (3.5.1.2) is an individual

NOTE: The customer and provider can connect and/or contract through a third-party service (3.5.1.1).

EXAMPLE: Ridesourcing.

docs.title: Formalization for peer-to-peer
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf contractualModel

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.7.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel peer-to-peer

docs.title: person
docs.text: biological entity (3.1.1.5) that is a human being

docs.title: Formalization for person
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf biologicalEntity

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.1.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel person

docs.title: personal information device
docs.text:
personal system (3.2.1.3) that enables personal access to traveller (3.6.1.1) information

EXAMPLE: Personal computer.

docs.title: Formalization for personal information device
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf personalSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS personal information device clause 3.2.4.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel personal information device

docs.title: personal system
docs.text: ITS component (3.1.8.2), other than a vehicle system (3.2.1.5), that is used by a person (3.1.1.6) in relation to a past, current or upcoming journey

docs.title: Formalization for personal system
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf itsComponent

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS personal system altPrefLabel traveller system clause 3.2.1.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel personal system

docs.title: physical object
docs.text:
abstraction of a material entity (3.1.1.3) that interacts with other abstract material entities in the provision of ITS services (3.5.3.1)

NOTE: Physical objects are represented as elements (3.1.3.10) within the physical view (3.1.4.7) and perform a role. Physical objects can be implemented as cloud-based systems (3.1.2.1).

docs.title: Formalization for physical object
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf resource subClassOf system

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS physical object clause 3.1.8.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel physical object

docs.title: physical traffic separator
docs.text:
mechanism used to physically separate a travelled way or pathway from the adjacent environment

NOTE: Mechanisms include various types of barriers, such as walls, rails, pylons, kerbs and ditches, as well as open, unpaved space. If two streams of traffic are only separated by paved space (including any markings and rumble strips), they share a common carriageway.

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.2.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel physical traffic separator

docs.title: physical view
docs.text:
architecture view (3.1.3.7) from the physical viewpoint (3.1.4.8)

NOTE: The term "deployment view" is sometimes used within the broader ICT community, but the term "physical view" is preferred to prevent confusion between the physical view of a reference architecture and any part of a deployment architecture (3.1.9.3).

docs.title: Formalization for physical view
docs.text: Property Constraint aggregates some physicalObject aggregates some informationTransfer aggregates some functionalObject subClassOf architectureView

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.4.7 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel physical view

docs.title: physical viewpoint
docs.text: architecture viewpoint (3.1.3.6) used to frame concerns (3.1.3.5) related to the assignment of functionality to physical objects (3.1.8.1) and the interfaces among these physical objects

docs.title: Formalization for physical viewpoint
docs.text: Property Constraint governs some physicalView subClassOf architectureViewpoint

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.4.8 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel physical viewpoint

docs.title: pick-up/drop-off area
docs.text:
area intended to allow passengers to board and/or alight from vehicles (3.7.1.1)

NOTE: The area can include the vehicle waiting area and the pedestrian waiting area.

EXAMPLE: kerbside passenger pick-up area at an airport arrivals zone

docs.title: Formalization for pick-up/drop-off area
docs.text: Property Constraint for some passenger toBoardOrAlightFrom some vehicle

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel PUDO area clause 3.3.8.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel pick-up/drop-off area

docs.title: planning architecture
docs.text:
architecture (3.1.3.1) that provides a long-term vision of system elements (3.1.3.10) that may be deployed and managed by different projects and/or entities (3.1.1.1) within a geographic area

NOTE: Some countries use the term "regional architecture", but in International Standards, the term "regional" is avoided due to its multiple meanings.

docs.title: Formalization for planning architecture
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf architecture

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.9.2 skos::altLabel regional architecture skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel planning architecture

docs.title: point coordinates
docs.text: coordinate tuple defining the geodetic position of a single point location (3.4.1.3) using a known geodetic reference system

docs.title: Formalization for point coordinates
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf coordinateTuple

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.4.1.11 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel point coordinates

docs.title: point destination
docs.text: point location, which is the destination of a defined route or itinerary

docs.title: Formalization for point destination
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf pointLocation

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.4.1.8 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel point destination

docs.title: point location
docs.text: spatial location (3.4.1.2) with no length in any of the spatial dimensions

docs.title: Formalization for point location
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf spatialLocation

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.4.1.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel point location

docs.title: pre-coded spatial reference
docs.text: spatial reference (3.4.2.2) using a unique identifier that is agreed upon in both the sender and receiver system (3.1.2.1) to select a location (3.4.1.1) from a set of pre-coded locations

docs.title: Formalization for pre-coded spatial reference
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf spatialReference

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.4.2.4 skos::altLabel pre-coded location reference skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel pre-coded spatial reference

docs.title: private customer model
docs.text: contractual model (3.5.7.1) where the user (3.5.1.3) is an individual

docs.title: Formalization for private customer model
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf contractualModel

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.7.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel private customer model

docs.title: private
docs.text:
financial model (3.5.8.1) where services (3.5.1.1) are provided to members of the owning organization without usage fees

EXAMPLE: Fleet vehicles of an employer.

docs.title: Formalization for private
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf financialModel

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.8.7 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel private

docs.title: process specification
docs.text: document (3.1.6.3) that defines a lowest-level process (3.1.7.2)

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.7.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel process specification

docs.title: process
docs.text: series of one or more functions (3.1.7.3) in support of an ITS service (3.5.3.1)

docs.title: Formalization for process
docs.text: Property Constraint aggregates some function

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel functional view process clause 3.1.7.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel process

docs.title: protected road user
docs.text:
road user (3.6.1.2) who is protected by the body of a motor vehicle that meets local safety regulations

EXAMPLE: vehicle occupants (3.6.2.2)

docs.title: Formalization for protected road user
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf roadUser

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.6.1.6 skos::altLabel non-vulnerable road user skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel protected road user

docs.title: public information device
docs.text:
personal system (3.2.1.3) that provides public (3.5.8.2) access to traveller (3.6.1.1) information

EXAMPLE: Kiosk.

docs.title: Formalization for public information device
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf personalSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS public information device clause 3.2.4.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel public information device

docs.title: public transport app
docs.text:
mobility app (3.5.13.1) that assists a transport user (3.5.2.3) in using a public transport (3.5.6.1) system (3.1.2.1)

NOTE: A public transport app can include features such as viewing maps, searching routes and schedules, real-time arrival information, ticketing, electronic boarding pass, etc.

docs.title: Formalization for public transport app
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf mobilityApp

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.5.7 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel public transport app

docs.title: public transport central management system
docs.text: centre system (3.2.1.1) that allows an entity (3.1.1.1) to manage the activities of a public transport (3.5.6.1) agency

docs.title: Formalization for public transport central management system
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf centralSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.2.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel public transport central management system

docs.title: public transport vehicle stop
docs.text:
pick-up/drop-off area (3.3.8.5) area for public transport vehicles

NOTE: The term "PTV stop" is often specialized to indicate the type of public transport vehicle (e.g., "bus stop", "tram stop").

docs.title: Formalization for public transport vehicle stop
docs.text: Property Constraint for some publicTransportVehicle subClassOf pick-upDrop-offArea

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel PTV stop clause 3.3.8.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel public transport vehicle stop

docs.title: public transport
docs.text:
transport service (3.5.2.1) that is publicly accessible enabling the movement of one or more persons (3.1.1.6)

NOTE: A public transport service can be scheduled or on-demand.

EXAMPLE: 1 Bus, tram, cable car, metro, train and ferry are examples of public transport means for collective use.

docs.title: Formalization for public transport
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf transportService

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel public transport service clause 3.5.6.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel public transport

docs.title: public
docs.text:
type of financial model (3.5.8.1) where services (3.5.1.1) are provided by an administrative authority in an attempt to better serve societal interests

NOTE: The transport service (3.5.2.1) is typically offered to the transport consumer for less than the full capital and operating cost of providing the service, but this is not a requirement.

docs.title: Formalization for public
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf financialModel

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.8.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel public

docs.title: real-time traveller information app
docs.text: mobility app (3.5.13.1) that provides information about current travel conditions to a transport user (3.5.2.3)

docs.title: Formalization for real-time traveller information app
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf mobilityApp

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.5.8 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel real-time traveller information app

docs.title: realization
docs.text:
implementation of a system concept

NOTE: A realization requires the development of a design and the translation of this design into hardware components, software components, or both.

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.15.4 dcterms::source ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017, example added skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel realization

docs.title: reference architecture
docs.text:
architecture (3.1.3.1) that provides a template solution for planning (3.1.9.2) and deployment architectures (3.1.9.3)

NOTE: Interface standards are based on a reference architecture, which should be explicitly described.

docs.title: Formalization for reference architecture
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf architecture

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.9.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel reference architecture

docs.title: relationship
docs.text: element (3.1.3.10) that represents an association between two resources (3.1.6.2)

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel enterprise view relationship clause 3.1.6.8 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel relationship

docs.title: remote driver
docs.text:
driver (3.6.2.3) that performs the dynamic driving task (3.7.3.1) without using the vehicle's (3.7.1.1) built-in input devices (3.7.1.5) to control the longitudinal and lateral movement of the vehicle

NOTE: A remote driver can use a variety of physical input devices, but none that are built into the vehicle.

docs.title: Formalization for remote driver
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf driver uses min 1 owl::Thing

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.6.2.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel remote driver

docs.title: remote vehicle input device
docs.text: input device (3.7.1.4) designed to be electronically connected (3.2.3.6) to a vehicle (3.7.1.1) even when the vehicle is not in close proximity

docs.title: Formalization for remote vehicle input device
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf vehicleInputDevice

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel remote input device clause 3.7.1.7 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel remote vehicle input device

docs.title: requirement
docs.text:
provision that contains criteria to be fulfilled

EXAMPLE: Example: A measurable characteristic of a smartphone

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.15.5 dcterms::source ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017, example added skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel requirement

docs.title: requirements specification
docs.text:
document that specifies the requirements for a system or component

NOTE: A device can conform to multiple requirements specifications, each with a different focus.

EXAMPLE: Example: Wi-Fi 7, 5G, Bluetooth 5.3

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.15.6 dcterms::source ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017, example and note added skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel requirements specification

docs.title: reserved lane
docs.text:
traffic lane (3.3.1.13) restricted to a specific subset of road vehicles (3.7.6.1) or user (3.5.1.3) categories

NOTE: A traffic lane may be reserved permanently or under certain conditions or times.

EXAMPLE: 1 Bus lane.

docs.title: Formalization for reserved lane
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf trafficLane

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.1.14 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel reserved lane

docs.title: resilience
docs.text: capability of a system to maintain its functions and structure in the face of internal and external change, and to degrade gracefully when this is necessary

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.14.11 dcterms::source ISO/IEC 23257:2019 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel resilience

docs.title: resource
docs.text: element (3.1.3.10) that represents an entity (3.1.1.1) that is managed, operated, referenced and/or used to develop and provide ITS (3.1.2.4)

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel enterprise view resource clause 3.1.6.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel resource

docs.title: rideshare service
docs.text: cooperative (3.5.8.4) shared transport service (3.5.6.2) that transports passengers (3.6.2.1) concurrently (3.5.9.3)

docs.title: Formalization for rideshare service
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf sharedTransportService

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.11.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel rideshare service

docs.title: ridesourced service
docs.text: commercial (3.5.8.2), peer-to-peer (3.5.7.5) shared transport service (3.5.6.2) that transports passengers (3.6.2.1)

docs.title: Formalization for ridesourced service
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf sharedTransportService

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.11.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ridesourced service

docs.title: ridesourcing app
docs.text: P2P mobility sharing app (3.5.13.5) for acquiring a ridesourced service (3.5.11.5)

docs.title: Formalization for ridesourcing app
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf p2pMobilitySharingApp

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.5.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ridesourcing app

docs.title: ridesplit service
docs.text: ridesourced service (3.5.11.5) that serves passengers (3.6.2.1) concurrently (3.5.9.3)

docs.title: Formalization for ridesplit service
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf ridesourcedService

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.11.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ridesplit service

docs.title: risk
docs.text: effect of uncertainty on objectives (3.1.14.10)

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.14.12 dcterms::source ISO/IEC 27000:2018, 3.61 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel risk

docs.title: road cycle
docs.text:
vehicle (3.7.1.1) meeting the legal requirements to operate in cycle lanes (3.3.3.1) and cycleways (3.3.3.2)

NOTE: In some countries, other special lanes (3.3.1.12) could also be open to road cycles, such as bus lanes.

docs.title: Formalization for road cycle
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf vehicle

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.6.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel road cycle

docs.title: road equipment
docs.text:
component of transport infrastructure (3.3.7.2) along the roadway intended to contribute to the safety, operations, management, awareness, and comfort of movements of the road users (3.6.1.2)

NOTE: Road equipment can be next to, over, on and/or in the roadway.

EXAMPLE: sign, traffic signal, safety rail, gantry, bus stop structure, highway safety lighting

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.9.1 skos::altLabel road furniture skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel road equipment

docs.title: road identifier
docs.text:
designator by a road authority to uniquely identify one or more curvilinear lengths of roadway (3.3.5.3) within the context of the road authority

NOTE: A single road identifier can be assigned to non-contiguous lengths of roadway.

docs.title: Formalization for road identifier
docs.text: Property Constraint identifies some road

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.5.12 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel road identifier

docs.title: road link
docs.text:
link (3.3.5.5) representing a contiguous length of a road (3.3.5.1) between two nodes (3.3.5.4) of operational or managerial significance

NOTE: The operational characteristics of the nodes would relate to the type of road model (3.3.5.3). For example, a traffic system (3.1.2.1) can base its road links on nodes that represent junctions (3.3.6.2) and road terminators (3.1.8.3).

docs.title: Formalization for road link
docs.text: Property Constraint aggregates some laneLink constitutes some roadSegment subClassOf link

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.5.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel road link

docs.title: road model
docs.text:
representation of a road network (3.3.5.2)

NOTE: Road models for different systems (3.1.2.1) will often define different models. For example, a public transport system (3.1.2.2) can define road links (3.3.5.6) based on the location (3.4.1.1) of bus stops while a traffic system can define road links based on the location of junctions (3.3.6.2).

docs.title: Formalization for road model
docs.text: Property Constraint constitutes some node constitutes some link represents some roadNetwork

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.5.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel road model

docs.title: road network
docs.text: interconnected collection of roads (3.3.5.1)

docs.title: Formalization for road network
docs.text: Property Constraint aggregates some road

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.5.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel road network

docs.title: road reservation
docs.text:
area legally reserved for road (3.3.5.1) transport purposes and support

NOTE: Support includes physical equipment such as safety devices, signage and controller cabinets as well as access by maintenance vehicles and personnel.

docs.title: Formalization for road reservation
docs.text: Property Constraint comprises some roadside comprises some lane comprises some roadway

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel easement clause 3.3.1.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel road reservation

docs.title: road section
docs.text:
aggregation of one or more road links (3.3.5.6) that represents a contiguous length of a road (3.3.5.1) that shares the same management and operational strategies

NOTE: Different road models (3.3.5.3) can divide the same road into different road sections.

EXAMPLE: 1 A traffic signal timing plan is applied to one road section.

docs.title: Formalization for road section
docs.text: Property Constraint aggregates some roadLink

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.5.7 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel road section

docs.title: road segment
docs.text:
link (3.3.5.5) that represents a contiguous length of a road link (3.3.5.6) characterized by the same physical characteristics

NOTE: The definition of road segments is highly dependent on which characteristics are modelled by the implementation. Characteristics that can result in a new road segment include addition or subtraction of a lane (3.3.1.12), a change in roadway (3.3.1.3) width, the change of road (3.3.5.1) type (e.g. start/end of a bridge), etc.

docs.title: Formalization for road segment
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf link

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.5.8 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel road segment

docs.title: road user
docs.text:
mobile material entity (3.1.1.3) within the road reservation (3.3.1.2)

EXAMPLE: Pedestrians (3.6.1.4), road work personnel, vehicle occupants (3.6.2.2), occupied and unoccupied vehicles, horses, etc.

docs.title: Formalization for road user
docs.text: Property Constraint locatedWithin some roadReservation
