docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.6.1.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel road user

docs.title: road vehicle
docs.text:
vehicle (3.7.1.1) meeting the requirements to operate within the driving space (3.3.1.4) of a road (3.3.5.1)

NOTE: Unless indicated otherwise, the term typically refers to vehicles that are allowed to operate in the same driving spaces as motorized passenger (3.6.2.1) cars, according to the legal requirements of the local jurisdictional entity (3.1.1.1). However, the term can be contextualized for other environments (3.1.3.11). For example, a bicycle is a "road vehicle" when the "road" is a cycleway (3.3.3.2).

docs.title: Formalization for road vehicle
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf vehicle

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.6.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel road vehicle

docs.title: road
docs.text:
curvilinear length of roadway (3.3.1.3) that shares the same road identifier (3.3.5.13)

NOTE: A length of the road network (3.3.5.2) may be referenced by multiple designators (e.g. Main Street and Route 7). In this case, there would be two "roads" that share the same set of "carriageways" (3.3.1.5).

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.5.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel road

docs.title: roadside unit
docs.text: part of connected roadside equipment (3.2.3.3) that provides wireless connectivity to vehicle systems (3.2.1.5) and/or personal systems (3.2.1.3)

docs.title: Formalization for roadside unit
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf connectedUnit

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS roadside unit altPrefLabel RSU clause 3.2.3.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel roadside unit

docs.title: roadside
docs.text:
portion of the road reservation (3.3.1.2) excluding all roadway (3.3.1.3) and driving space(s) (3.3.1.4)

NOTE: Roadside, shoulder (3.3.1.18) and verge (3.3.1.11) define similar but slightly different concepts

docs.title: Formalization for roadside
docs.text: Property Constraint comprises some verge

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.1.10 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel roadside

docs.title: roadway
docs.text:
part of the surface of the road reservation (3.3.1.2) primarily designed for the movement of vehicles (3.7.1.1) that conform to a specified set of requirements

NOTE: A roadway is characterized using a cross-section (3.3.1.1) of a road facility as the roadway characteristics often change along the length of the road. See "road" (3.3.5.1), "road section" (3.3.5.7), "road segment" (3.3.5.8), and "road link" (3.3.5.6) for different types of stretches of roadway.

docs.title: Formalization for roadway
docs.text: Property Constraint comprises some travelledWay

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.1.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel roadway

docs.title: role
docs.text: element (3.1.3.10) that represents the specified responsibilities between an enterprise object (3.1.6.1) and another enterprise view (3.1.4.3) element

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel enterprise view role clause 3.1.12.3 clause 3.1.6.7 dcterms::source ISO/IEC 11179-3:2013, 3.2.121 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel role

docs.title: scenario
docs.text: description of the sequence of events from the user's (3.5.1.3) perspective to perform a task in a specified context

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel use case scenario clause 3.1.12.2 dcterms::source ISO/IEC 25062:2006, A.17 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel scenario

docs.title: security entity
docs.text: part of the ITS station reference architecture (3.1.9.4) that is responsible for providing communication security and system (3.1.2.1) security

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS-S security entity clause 3.1.5.7 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel security entity

docs.title: sensor
docs.text: device (ISO/IEC 24765:2017, 3.1187) with the capability of observing one or more properties (ISO/IEC 24765:2017, 3.3207) of a material entity (3.1.1.3) and converting those properties into meaningful signals (ISO/IEC 24765:2017, 3.3738)

docs.title: Formalization for sensor
docs.text: Property Constraint observesPropertyOf some materialEntity

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.10.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel sensor

docs.title: sequential
docs.text:
operational model (3.5.9.1) where services (3.5.1.1) are provided to a single user (3.5.1.3) at any one time

NOTE: A single transport consumer can request the transport of multiple passengers (3.6.2.1).

EXAMPLE: Traditional taxi service.

docs.title: Formalization for sequential
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf operationalModel

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.9.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel sequential

docs.title: service alley
docs.text:
alley designed to facilitate the provision of services for adjacent locations

EXAMPLE: alley for trash collection

docs.title: Formalization for service alley
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf alley

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.5.14 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel service alley

docs.title: service provider
docs.text: entity (3.1.1.1) that delivers one or more services (3.5.1.1)

docs.title: Formalization for service provider
docs.text: Property Constraint delivers some service subClassOf entity

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.1.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel service provider

docs.title: service road
docs.text:
road designed to facilitate the provision of services to customers

EXAMPLE: road used to access parking spaces or pick-up/drop-off area

docs.title: Formalization for service road
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf road

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.5.13 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel service road

docs.title: service
docs.text: provision of one or more capabilities, functionalities or facilities to fulfil or enable the fulfilment of a user need (3.5.1.4)

docs.title: Formalization for service
docs.text: Property Constraint for some user fulfils some userNeed

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.1.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel service

docs.title: shared space
docs.text:
public area space for use by users with distinctly different characteristics

NOTE: The space can be for travel, gatherings, rest, or other purposes.

EXAMPLE: facility designed for the use of pedestrians, cycles, and motor vehicles

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.3.8 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel shared space

docs.title: shared transport service
docs.text:
transport service (3.5.2.1) that relies upon the same resources (3.1.6.2) to fulfil the transport needs (3.5.2.4) of multiple unrelated transport users (3.5.2.3) and where the transport provider (3.5.2.2) has the primary responsibility for the operation of the transport mode

NOTE: A shared transport service might not be dependent upon a vehicle and/or could be multi-modal. For example, a letter courier service could rely on walking and public transport (3.5.6.1).

docs.title: Formalization for shared transport service
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf transportService

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.6.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel shared transport service

docs.title: shared vehicle service
docs.text:
transport service (3.5.2.1) that sequentially (3.5.9.2) provides the same vehicles (3.7.1.1) to multiple unrelated transport users (3.5.2.3) and where the transport user has the primary responsibility for the operation of the vehicle

NOTE: As there should only be one operator of a vehicle at any time, a shared vehicle service should use a sequential operational model.

docs.title: Formalization for shared vehicle service
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf transportService

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.6.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel shared vehicle service

docs.title: shoulder
docs.text:
either a hard shoulder (3.3.1.19) or a soft shoulder (3.3.1.20)

NOTE: In some jurisdictions, a shoulder can be used for emergency stops and/or other purposes in addition to providing a clear zone for safety purposes.

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.1.18 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel shoulder

docs.title: shuttle service
docs.text:
shared transport service (3.5.6.2) that transports passengers (3.6.2.1) between two specified locations (3.4.1.1)

NOTE: Each location can be defined as point, linear or area locations (3.4.1.6). However, the areas of the two locations should not overlap.

docs.title: Formalization for shuttle service
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf sharedTransportService

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.11.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel shuttle service

docs.title: sidewalk
docs.text:
footpath (3.3.3.3) along a roadside (3.3.1.10)

NOTE: A paved footway is called a "pavement" in the British English.

docs.title: Formalization for sidewalk
docs.text: Property Constraint along some roadside subClassOf lane subClassOf footpath

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel footway clause 3.3.3.4 skos::altLabel pavement skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022; footway added as a synonym in 2025. skos::prefLabel sidewalk

docs.title: single carriageway
docs.text:
having exactly one carriageway (3.3.1.5)

NOTE: The "single carriageway" term can be used to describe a road, road section, road link, or road segment.

docs.title: Formalization for single carriageway
docs.text: Property Constraint comprises exactly 1 owl::Thing subClassOf roadway

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.1.7 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel single carriageway

docs.title: soft shoulder
docs.text:
unpaved part of the road reservation (3.3.1.2) not belonging to the carriageway (3.3.1.5) but providing lateral support to it

NOTE: Soft shoulders are not normally intended for driving.

docs.title: Formalization for soft shoulder
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf shoulder

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.1.20 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel soft shoulder

docs.title: spatial location
docs.text:
location (3.4.1.1) within three-dimensional space

NOTE: The "location" could be a point (consuming no space) or could consume space in one, two, or three dimensions. In any case, the location is identified within a larger space.

docs.title: Formalization for spatial location
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf location

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS spatial location clause 3.4.1.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel spatial location

docs.title: spatial reference
docs.text:
description of a spatial location (3.4.1.2) in the real world according to a defined reference system

NOTE: It is not necessary for the rules be formal coordinates but they could be descriptive.

EXAMPLE: Coordinate tuple: 51.476852, -0.000500.

docs.title: Formalization for spatial reference
docs.text: Property Constraint specificationOf some spatialLocation

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS spatial reference clause 3.4.2.2 skos::altLabel location reference skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel spatial reference

docs.title: speed
docs.text:
rate of change of a material entity's (3.1.1.3) position with respect to a frame of reference

NOTE: Speed is a function of time.

docs.title: Formalization for speed
docs.text: Property Constraint rateOfChangeOfPositionOf exactly 1 owl::Thing

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.2.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel speed

docs.title: stakeholder
docs.text: individual, team, organization, or classes (3.1.12.2) thereof, having an interest in a system (3.1.2.1)

docs.title: Formalization for stakeholder
docs.text: Property Constraint has some concern

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel system stakeholder clause 3.1.3.4 dcterms::source ISO/IEC/IEEE 42010:2011, 3.10 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel stakeholder

docs.title: station-based one-way
docs.text: operational mode (3.5.9.1) where the transport service (3.5.2.1) is initiated and terminated at two different facilities managed by the transport provider (3.5.2.2)

docs.title: Formalization for station-based one-way
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf networkModel

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.10.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel station-based one-way

docs.title: station-based roundtrip
docs.text: operational mode (3.5.9.1) where the transport service (3.5.2.1) is initiated and terminated at the same facility managed by the transport provider (3.5.2.2)

docs.title: Formalization for station-based roundtrip
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf networkModel

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.10.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel station-based roundtrip

docs.title: support system
docs.text:
ITS component (3.1.8.2) that provides services in support of one or more other ITS components

EXAMPLE: Data distribution system (3.1.2.1), network time source, cooperative ITS (3.1.2.5) credentials management system.

docs.title: Formalization for support system
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf itsComponent

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS support system clause 3.2.1.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel support system

docs.title: surface transport system
docs.text:
transport system (3.1.2.2) designed to move material entities (3.1.1.3) across the surface or near-surface of the Earth

NOTE: A surface transport system can include tunnels, bridges and similar elements (3.1.3.10).

docs.title: Formalization for surface transport system
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf transportSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.2.3 skos::altLabel transport system skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel surface transport system

docs.title: system
docs.text: combination of interacting elements (3.1.3.10) organized to achieve one or more stated purposes

docs.title: Formalization for system
docs.text: Property Constraint designedFor some user exhibits some architecture situatedIn some environment

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.2.1 dcterms::source ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288:2015, 4.1.46, modified - Notes to entry removed. skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel system

docs.title: taxi hailing app
docs.text: mobility app (3.5.13.1) that assists a transport user (3.5.2.3) in electronically requesting a taxi

docs.title: Formalization for taxi hailing app
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf mobilityApp

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.5.9 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel taxi hailing app

docs.title: taxi service
docs.text: commercial (3.5.8.2) shared transport service (3.5.6.2) that transports passengers (3.6.2.1) sequentially (3.5.9.2)

docs.title: Formalization for taxi service
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf sharedTransportService

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.11.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel taxi service

docs.title: taxi-share service
docs.text: commercial (3.5.8.2) shared transport service (3.5.6.2) that transports passengers (3.6.2.1) concurrently (3.5.9.3)

docs.title: Formalization for taxi-share service
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf sharedTransportService

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.11.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel taxi-share service

docs.title: terminator
docs.text:
entity (3.1.1.1) that is external to the ITS service (3.5.3.1) implementation but with which the implementation communicates either to obtain inputs or to which it can send outputs

NOTE: A terminator can exist within functional (3.1.4.5) and physical views (3.1.4.7).

docs.title: Formalization for terminator
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf physicalObject

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS terminator clause 3.1.8.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel terminator

docs.title: threat
docs.text: potential cause of an unwanted incident, which can result in harm to a system or organization

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.14.13 dcterms::source ISO/IEC 27000:2018, 3.75 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel threat

docs.title: traffic control device
docs.text: road equipment (3.3.9.1) used to visually, audibly, or tangibly convey regulatory, advisory, or guidance information to road users (3.6.1.2)

docs.title: Formalization for traffic control device
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf roadEquipment

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.9.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel traffic control device

docs.title: traffic lane
docs.text:
portion of carriageway (3.3.1.5) designed to accommodate a single line of moving road vehicles (3.7.6.1)

NOTE: The term "lane" is often used to refer to a "traffic lane" when the context is known to be "traffic".

docs.title: Formalization for traffic lane
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf lane

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel lane clause 3.3.1.13 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel traffic lane

docs.title: traffic management central system
docs.text: centre system (3.2.1.1) that monitors and controls traffic and the road network (3.3.5.2)

docs.title: Formalization for traffic management central system
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf centralSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.2.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel traffic management central system

docs.title: traffic regulation central system
docs.text: centre system (3.2.1.1) that officially records traffic regulations in electronic form so that they can be distributed to other systems

docs.title: Formalization for traffic regulation central system
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf centralSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.2.7 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel traffic regulation central system

docs.title: transnet layer
docs.text:
communications layer in the ITS station reference architecture (3.1.9.4) corresponding to the network and transport layers of the OSI model

NOTE: The full name of this layer is the networking and transport layer, but the term transnet layer provides a more concise name.

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS-S networking and transport layer altPrefLabel networking and transport layer clause 3.1.5.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel transnet layer

docs.title: transparency
docs.text: open, comprehensive and understandable presentation of information

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.14.14 dcterms::source ISO/IEC 19944-1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel transparency

docs.title: transport facility
docs.text: physical structure or installation, including related site works, serving one or more transport-related purposes

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.7.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel transport facility

docs.title: transport information central system
docs.text: centre system (3.2.1.1) that provides information of interest to the travelling public

docs.title: Formalization for transport information central system
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf centralSystem

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.2.2.8 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel transport information central system

docs.title: transport infrastructure
docs.text:
system of transport facilities (3.3.7.1) and equipment needed for a transport system

NOTE: Transport infrastructure typically includes or shares telecommunications infrastructure in the case of ITS.

docs.title: Formalization for transport infrastructure
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf system systemOf some transportFacility

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.7.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel transport infrastructure

docs.title: transport provider
docs.text: entity (3.1.1.1) that delivers one or more transport services (3.5.2.1)

docs.title: Formalization for transport provider
docs.text: Property Constraint delivers some transportService subClassOf serviceProvider

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel provider altPrefLabel service provider clause 3.5.2.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel transport provider

docs.title: transport service
docs.text:
service (3.5.1.1) that transports one or more material entities (3.1.1.3) from one location (3.4.1.1) to another

NOTE: The material entities transported can be people and/or goods.

docs.title: Formalization for transport service
docs.text: Property Constraint for some transportUser fulfils some transportUserNeed subClassOf service transports some materialEntity

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel service clause 3.5.2.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel transport service

docs.title: transport sharing
docs.text: using a shared transport service (3.5.6.2)

docs.title: Formalization for transport sharing
docs.text: Property Constraint using some sharedTransportService

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.6.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel transport sharing

docs.title: transport system
docs.text:
system (3.1.2.1) of infrastructure elements (3.1.3.10) and optionally vehicles (3.7.1.1) that are jointly designed to move material entities (3.1.1.3) from an origin to a destination

NOTE: Transport systems can also include any supporting system, such as information and control systems.

docs.title: Formalization for transport system
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf system

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.2.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel transport system

docs.title: transport user need
docs.text: user need (3.5.1.4) to transport one or more material entities (3.1.1.3) to a different location (3.4.1.1)

docs.title: Formalization for transport user need
docs.text: Property Constraint desiredResultsOf some transportUser desireToTransport some materialEntity subClassOf userNeed

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel need altPrefLabel user need clause 3.5.2.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel transport user need

docs.title: transport user
docs.text: entity (3.1.1.1) that has a desire to transport a material entity (3.1.1.3)

docs.title: Formalization for transport user
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf user

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel consumer altPrefLabel user clause 3.5.2.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel transport user

docs.title: travelled way
docs.text:
part of the roadway (3.3.1.3) that is currently intended for transport purposes

NOTE: The travelled way does not include hard shoulders (3.3.1.19), hardstanding (3.3.1.17), or other areas that are not currently intended for normal operational use. In other words, while these other areas are "designed" for transport purposes, they are not "intended" for normal transport purposes (at present); rather these extra areas exist for safety and other exceptional use conditions.

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.1.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel travelled way

docs.title: traveller
docs.text: person (3.1.1.6) who is headed to a destination

docs.title: Formalization for traveller
docs.text: Property Constraint isA some person

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.6.1.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel traveller

docs.title: trip aggregator app
docs.text:
mobility app (3.5.13.1) that assists a transport user (3.5.2.3) in planning trips that may span multiple vehicle modes or transport providers (3.5.2.2)

NOTE: The assistance can include reservations, ticketing and similar services (3.5.1.1).

docs.title: Formalization for trip aggregator app
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf mobilityApp

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.5.10 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel trip aggregator app

docs.title: trustworthiness
docs.text: ability to meet stakeholders expectations in a verifiable way

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.14.15 dcterms::source ISO/IEC 5723 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel trustworthiness

docs.title: ultra-low vehicle speed
docs.text:
speed (3.7.2.1) of a vehicle (3.7.1.1) that does not greatly exceed typical pedestrian (3.6.1.4) speeds

NOTE: Local regulations for the exact speed range vary.

EXAMPLE: SAE J3194 associates this with a top speed of less than 13 km/h.

docs.title: Formalization for ultra-low vehicle speed
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf speed

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.5.7 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ultra-low vehicle speed

docs.title: ultra-low-speed vehicle
docs.text:
vehicle (3.7.1.1) with a design speed (3.7.2.2) that does not exceed ultra-low vehicle speeds (3.7.5.7)

NOTE: The term "pedestrian speed vehicle" is allowed but the preferred term follows a logical progression of levels.

docs.title: Formalization for ultra-low-speed vehicle
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf vehicle

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.5.1 skos::altLabel pedestrian-speed vehicle skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel ultra-low-speed vehicle

docs.title: unconnected
docs.text: characteristic of a material entity (3.1.1.3) that is equipped with communications equipment that is not active or is otherwise unable to send data to or receive data from connected (3.2.3.6) entities

docs.title: Formalization for unconnected
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf off-grid

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS unconnected clause 3.7.4.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel unconnected

docs.title: unequipped
docs.text: characteristic of a material entity (3.1.1.3) that is not and has never been equipped with communications equipment for sending data to or receiving data from connected (3.2.3.6) entities

docs.title: Formalization for unequipped
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf off-grid

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS unequipped clause 3.7.4.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel unequipped

docs.title: usable width
docs.text: all traffic lanes (3.3.1.13) of a carriageway (3.3.1.5)

docs.title: Formalization for usable width
docs.text: Property Constraint comprises some trafficLane

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.1.15 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel usable width

docs.title: use case
docs.text: description of the behavioural requirements of a system (3.1.2.1) and its interaction (3.1.6.4) with a user (3.5.1.3)

docs.title: Formalization for use case
docs.text: Property Constraint aggregates some scenario

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.12.1 dcterms::source ISO/IEC/IEEE 26515:2018, 3.15, modified - Note 1 to entry removed. skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel use case

docs.title: user need
docs.text: desired results of a user (3.5.1.3) within a specified context of use

docs.title: Formalization for user need
docs.text: Property Constraint desiredResultsOf some user

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel need clause 3.5.1.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel user need

docs.title: user
docs.text:
entity (3.1.1.1) for whom the system (3.1.2.1) of interest is designed

NOTE: The term "consumer" can be used when fulfilling the need results in the consumption of a resource (3.1.6.2).

docs.title: Formalization for user
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf entity

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel consumer clause 3.5.1.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel user

docs.title: value domain
docs.text: a set of permissible values

docs.title: Formalization for value domain
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf dataConcept

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.11.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel value domain

docs.title: vehicle equipment
docs.text: type of equipment in use or on board the vehicle

docs.title: Formalization for vehicle equipment
docs.text: Property Constraint inUseOrOnBoard exactly 1 owl::Thing

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.2.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel vehicle equipment

docs.title: vehicle fuel type
docs.text: type of fuel used by the vehicle

docs.title: Formalization for vehicle fuel type
docs.text: Property Constraint fuelUsedBy exactly 1 owl::Thing

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.2.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel vehicle fuel type

docs.title: vehicle identifier
docs.text: series of 17 characters that is based on either ISO 3779 or ISO 3780 and uniquely identifies the individual vehicle and is normally securely attached to the vehicle chassis

docs.title: Formalization for vehicle identifier
docs.text: Property Constraint globallyUniqueIdentifierFor exactly 1 owl::Thing

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.2.6 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel vehicle identifier

docs.title: vehicle input device
docs.text:
material entity (3.1.1.3) that can affect the vehicle's (3.7.1.1) operation

NOTE: Input devices include those used to control the motion of the vehicle (e.g. a brake pedal), the state of vehicular equipment (e.g. headlight control), the configuration of the vehicle (e.g. temperature control), etc.

EXAMPLE: steering wheel, lever, pedal, knob, button, touch screen

docs.title: Formalization for vehicle input device
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf materialEntity

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel input device clause 3.7.1.4 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel vehicle input device

docs.title: vehicle load type
docs.text: type of load carried by the vehicle

docs.title: Formalization for vehicle load type
docs.text: Property Constraint loadCarriedBy exactly 1 owl::Thing

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.2.7 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel vehicle load type

docs.title: vehicle occupant
docs.text:
person (3.1.1.6) in or on a vehicle (3.7.1.1)

NOTE: A vehicle occupant in a stationary vehicle is not necessarily a traveller (3.6.1.1).

docs.title: Formalization for vehicle occupant
docs.text: Property Constraint isA some person isIn some vehicle

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.6.2.2 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel vehicle occupant

docs.title: vehicle registration plate identifier
docs.text: numeric or alphanumeric identifier or code, displayed on a registration plate attached to the vehicle, and unique within the issuing authority's region therefore usable for official identification purposes

docs.title: Formalization for vehicle registration plate identifier
docs.text: Property Constraint identifierUniqueWithinRegionFor exactly 1 owl::Thing

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.2.8 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel vehicle registration plate identifier

docs.title: vehicle sharing
docs.text:
using a shared vehicle service (3.5.6.3)

NOTE: This term can be specialized by replacing "vehicle" with any defined vehicle type. However, in some cases the preferred form is to consolidate terms (e.g. "carsharing" rather than "passenger car sharing").

docs.title: Formalization for vehicle sharing
docs.text: Property Constraint using some sharedVehicleService

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.5.6.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel vehicle sharing

docs.title: vehicle system
docs.text: ITS component (3.1.8.2) that is installed as a component of a vehicle (3.7.1.1)

docs.title: Formalization for vehicle system
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf itsComponent

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value altPrefLabel ITS vehicle system clause 3.2.1.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel vehicle system

docs.title: vehicle
docs.text: material entity (3.1.1.3) designed to transport people or physical goods by changing its physical position

docs.title: Formalization for vehicle
docs.text: Property Constraint canBe min 1 owl::Thing ddtControlledBy exactly 1 owl::Thing has min 0 owl::Thing has min 0 owl::Thing has some vehicleInputDevice subClassOf materialEntity

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.1.1 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel vehicle

docs.title: verge
docs.text:
unpaved part of the roadside (3.3.1.10) designed for travel safety purposes

NOTE: A verge can separate two lanes (3.3.1.12) of different modes, separate a traffic lane (3.3.1.13) from a ditch, or separate a lane from another safety hazard.

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.3.1.11 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel verge

docs.title: vulnerability
docs.text: weakness of an asset or control (3.1.14.3) that can be exploited by one or more threats (3.1.14.13)

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.1.14.16 dcterms::source ISO/IEC 27000:2018, 3.77 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel vulnerability

docs.title: vulnerable road user
docs.text:
road user (3.6.1.2) who is not protected by the body of a motor vehicle that meets local safety regulations

EXAMPLE: Pedestrian (3.6.1.4), cyclist, motorcyclist, road work personnel, horse, horseback rider, person with disabilities (e.g., wheelchair), etc.

docs.title: Formalization for vulnerable road user
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf roadUser

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.6.1.5 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2025 skos::prefLabel vulnerable road user

docs.title: wheel
docs.text: circular material entity (3.1.1.3) that rotates about an axle to facilitate movement of the vehicle (3.7.1.1)

docs.title: Formalization for wheel
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf materialEntity

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value clause 3.7.1.3 skos::historyNote Introduced in ISO/TS 14812:2022 skos::prefLabel wheel
